entry.title: How to buy US stocks
entry.content:
It‚Äôs been two days since the American election.
As a leek, I won‚Äôt share because of jet lag.
High takeover, midnight plunge wakes up cutthroat
Now I‚Äôm embarrassed that I‚Äôm afraid to enter the market while watching it rocket upward.

Just share the heartbreak of opening an account.

U.S. brokerage firms

Since many U.S. brokerages are commission-free, the first ones to look at are

  • Robinhood (better user interface)
  • TD Ameritrade (old school)
  • Firstrade (Chinese customer service)

Robinhood was invited to send shares to both parties, so I asked my US partner for the code, and then I went to the official website and found out that I could only submit in the US‚Ä¶
TD Ameritrade does have SG, a website, but I don‚Äôt know how I got stuck in the last step after I submitted my information, and no one reviewed my emails.
Firstrade, a non-American automatically submits the tax exemption form, after submitting the information, the account finally opened after a few business days, and then found that the deposit can only ACH, Check, Wire Trannsfer

ACH, Check, all require a transfer from your own US bank account, so you can‚Äôt.
Wire Trannsfer wants another fee.

Singapore brokerages

Then I researched Singapore and found out that these people even use UOB or DBS Trading Account.
All I hear is that the fees are sky-high and not worth it.

Domestic brokerage firms

Well, it‚Äôs come full circle and back again‚Ä¶

  • Mi‚Äôs Tiger
  • Tencent‚Äôs FuTou
  • Snow Globes of Snow Glow

Happier Tigers Support Singapore account opening and can

  • U.S., Hong Kong, Singapore and Australian stocks‚Ä¶
  • Support pre post market, futures
  • lever

I was going to upload my passport and stuff, but I was ready to do it anyway.
It turns out that Singpass authentication is supported, so I clicked on it and jumped back and forth‚Ä¶

God, I knew it would be so easy.
I opened it last year. Doesn‚Äôt it smell good?

Otherwise, it‚Äôs been multiplied by this time.
Or he‚Äôs already jumped off the roof.

Transaction costs

Because I don‚Äôt buy options.
Additional expenses for normal trading are divided into three segments

  • Buy 2$.
  • Total Shares 0.1%
  • Sell 2$

So even if you‚Äôre naked, the tiger is still in the money.

Refer code

You can use my code 0CM1QE.

I see the current campaign as a two-way street.

  • 5 free commissions
  • Charge 2000SGD get 30SGD free,3W get 100SGD free.

Well, no desire to refer at all.
I remember I used to give away one share of Ali‚Äôs stock. Is it too high to give now?

Transcripts

Just look at my report card after two days of global stock market rally, sleepless nights and a tiger-like operation.

!

So what are you waiting for, sign up now!

I‚Äôll wait for you on the rooftop.

entry.title: What is Python Used for
entry.content:
What is Python Used for? | Major Industries | Juni Learning

Juni Learning

How is Python used in the real world?

Python is one of the most popular languages for coding in the world.

The majority of top U.S. colleges even use Python in their introductory coding classes: teaching students to use Python to build simple games, parse information from web pages, and even conduct language processing!

Still, many parents and students alike often wonder ‚Äî how is Python actually used in companies or various fields?

Read on to learn how Python powers today‚Äôs leading industries, and plays a major role in numerous computer science disciplines.

Why Python?

Python is a high-level and general-purpose coding language ‚Äî meaning that it‚Äôs easier to understand and can be used to solve a variety of problems!

With its simple syntax, high readability, usability across operating systems, Python is a valuable language to both learn and use for a variety of applications.

An example of Python code on an engineer‚Äôs screen.

It‚Äôs therefore not surprising that Python is prevalent in not only today‚Äôs job market, but also in common technology we use everyday.

Python programming is a skill that can be used in virtually any industry, as well as in positions far beyond just software development. From industries like finance, healthcare, and insurance, to fields like aerospace to entertainment ‚Äî Python-based tech is driving innovation and new solutions.

In our What is Python 101 guide, we introduced Python as well as a few of the fields Python is used in such as tech, finance, and biotech. But in this article, we‚Äôll be taking a deeper look at even more of Python‚Äôs broad uses ‚Äî specifically in the following areas:

  • Web development
  • Data science
  • Machine learning
  • Artificial intelligence

Applications of Python

Web Development

While HTML, CSS, and Javascript may be the common choice of tools when it comes to web development, Python is also a great choice.

Web development refers to the building of websites on the internet, from static, plain text pages to dynamic ecommerce sites and interactive internet applications.

Coding is crucial in web development to build out site functions, optimize user experience, and ensure that that information is organized properly. Python‚Äôs web frameworks such as Django and Flask have become popular options for website development.

Python is a great option for backend web development, and is used by many companies today.

These open-source frameworks allow users to build web applications more efficiently due to Python‚Äôs ability to handle vast amounts of data and automate tasks. In fact, companies such as Instagram, Pinterest and Googleincorporate Python in their backend web development.

Data Science

Python is also a major language of choice when it comes to data science and data analysis.

In the age of big data, we come into contact with data frequently in our everyday lives, with technology such as navigation (GPS), online shopping, energy use, and wearables such as smart watches.

The average household contains around eleven devices and that number is likely to increase in the future! With so many devices, there is a vast amount of data that businesses need to process in order to provide their services.

Python-based tools are often used to visualize, process, and analyze large amounts of data.

Data science relates to processing data and inferencing trends ‚Äî and Python is incredibly useful in this area due its intensive packages like scipy, numpy, and pandas.

Additionally, the matplotlib package can be used to build data visualizations. This makes Python a popular choice in fields like bioinformatics that also involve a lot of data and modeling.

These Python-based tools have become popular due to their ease of use and scalability. For example, Netflix uses scipy and numpy for numerical computing to manage user traffic across the platform.

‚ñ∂ Try it: Advanced Data Science & Python Tutorial

Machine Learning

By analyzing vast amounts of data, machine learning algorithms can find patterns and apply those patterns to make sense of future behavior.

The most obvious use of machine learning in products is recommendation systems. Companies such as Netflix, Spotify, and Youtube collect user activity to make predictions and suggest playlists and videos.

Scikit-learn and tensorflow are Python libraries that enable the use of algorithms for classification, clustering, and regression on large data sets. The high performance and extensive functionality of these libraries make them essential in any exploration of machine learning.

‚ñ∂ Learn More: The Importance of Algorithms for Kids

Artificial Intelligence

Machine learning is actually just one facet of artificial intelligence. AI refers to the intelligence of machines and the development of computer systems to perform human-oriented tasks such as perception or decision making.

One prominent example of artificial intelligence is in ridesharing apps, like Uberand Lyft.

Python is used in artificial intelligence for apps like Lyft or Uber. The AI system can then predict things like user demand and estimated arrival times.

Uber utilizes AI for predicting user demand and estimated arrival times(among other features) and much of this is accomplished through Python.

In addition to some of the previously mentioned Python libraries, AI functionality such as prediction models and neural networks can be created through other libraries like keras and pytorch.

Python is Everywhere!

Among popular programming languages, Python is one of the most diverse in its applications. Moreover, it‚Äôs deeply integrated within our everyday life as well as today‚Äôs leading companies.

The range of careers that involve Python include software engineer, web developer, data scientist, product manager, business analyst and more. Regardless of industry, companies in this technological age rely on data-driven decision making and Python is the perfect tool to do just that.

If you or your child are interested in the fields or roles listed above, then learning Python is a great choice!

Want to Become a Python Programmer?

One of Python‚Äôs greatest strengths is helping new coders learn basic concepts and become familiar with programming! There are also many resources widely available to learn Python, for new coders of all ages.

Python Classes for Kids

A Juni Instructor teaches basic Python to a young student.

At Juni Learning, we teach Python to aspiring young coders ages 11-18, with the help of experienced coding instructors. From solidifying coding basics, to building algorithms and analyzing datasets, these courses explore the many different applications of Python and teach students how to build their own coding projects.

Read more about our coding courses and curriculum, or get started with our Admissions Team to learn which course is best for your child‚Äôs coding journey.

This article originally appeared on junilearning.com.

entry.title: How to Clean MacBook Dust & Fan
entry.content:
If kernel_task is using a large percentage of your Mac CPU

I have noticed before that kernel_task will be 100% stuck at every turn, but it is a System process. There is no way.

According to Ô£ø‚Äôs documentation If kernel_task is using a large percentage of your Mac CPU

In other words, kernel_task responds to conditions that cause your CPU to become too hot, even if your Mac doesn‚Äôt feel hot to you. It does not itself cause those conditions. When the CPU temperature decreases, kernel_task automatically reduces its activity.

This is because the CPU is too hot üî• even if you think it‚Äôs not hot ü•∂‚Ä¶

In addition, kernel_task is not the culprit. When the CPU is not hot, its occupancy rate will automatically go down‚Ä¶

I also found out that it should not be on the left üëà charging üîã, believe it

Here‚Äôs why you shouldn‚Äôt charge your MacBook Pro on the left side

While charging the MacBook Pro and having peripherals plugged in to the left-hand ports, the device‚Äôs ports can get hot; for some reason, this can result in kernel_task going a bit haywire and using up a whole boatload of system resources.

But after switching to the right üëâ charging üîã after a few days, it was 100% after a while

despair‚Ä¶

Suddenly wondered if it was because of the need to clean up

How to Clean MacBook Dust & Fan

It took Google to know that you can disassemble it yourself
Mine is a 16 book, which has been guaranteed
Otherwise according to Mac Warranty
If you dismantle it yourself, you should lose it

This Warranty does not apply:

  • (c) to damage caused by use a third party component or product that does not meet the Apple Product‚Äôs specifications

tool üîß

  • Penta screw üî© knife
  • Soot ball, small brush
  • Abandoned credit card üí≥

Ê≠•È™§

  1. Unscrew
  2. Make a small slit on the side
  3. Insert the unused credit card üí≥ and slide it in the direction of the blue arrow
    1. You will hear a click
    2. In Figure 2 you can see that there are four buckles in the middle horizontal line
    3. Instead of breaking something (I hope so üòì)
  4. Use symmetrically on the right üí≥ to slide
  5. Then press the red arrow to pull it horizontally
    1. Figure 2 The card slot can be seen above the fan
    2. So force horizontally, pull left and right ‚ÜîÔ∏è a little bit symmetrically
  6. The back cover is opened

Really dirty

After cleaning up the dust, kernel_task does not appear much, and üíª is also resurrected
I instantly feel that the notebook for 16 üíª can be used for 5 years üë®‚Äçüíª

entry.title: Python vs Java for Kids
entry.content:
This article originally appeared on junilearning.com

Python vs. Java: Uses, Performance, Learning

In the world of computer science, there are many programming languages, and no single language is superior to another. In other words, each language is best suited to solve certain problems, and in fact there is often no one best language to choose for a given programming project. For this reason, it is important for students who wish to develop software or to solve interesting problems through code to have strong computer science fundamentals that will apply across any programming language.

Programming languages tend to share certain characteristics in how they function, for example in the way they deal with memory usage or how heavily they use objects. Students will start seeing these patterns as they are exposed to more languages. This article will focus primarily on Python versus Java, which are two of the most widely used programming languages in the world. While it is hard to measure exactly the rate at which each programming language is growing, these are two of the most popular programming languages used in industry today.

One major difference between Python and Java is that Python is dynamically typed, while Java is statically typed. Loosely, this means that Java is much more strict about how variables are defined and used in code. As a result, Java tends to be more verbose in its syntax, which is one of the reasons we recommend learning Python before Java for beginners. For example, here is how you would create a variable named numbers that holds the numbers 0 through 9 in Python:

Here‚Äôs how you would do the same thing in Java:

Another major difference is that Java generally runs programs more quickly than Python, as it is a compiled language. This means that before a program is actually run, the compiler translates the Java code into machine-level code. By contrast, Python is an interpreted language, meaning there is no compile step.

Usage and Practicality

Historically, Java has been the more popular language in part due to its lengthy legacy. However, Python is rapidly gaining ground. According to Github‚Äôs State of the Octoberst Report, it has recently surpassed Java as the most widely used programming language. As per the 2018 developer survey, Python is now the fastest-growing computer programing language.

Both Python and Java have large communities of developers to answer questions on websites like Stack Overflow. As you can see from Stack Overflow trends, Python surpassed Java in terms the percentage of questions asked about it on Stack Overflow in 2017. At the time of writing, about 13% of the questions on Stack Overflow are tagged with Python, while about 8% are tagged with Java!

Web Development

Python and Java can both be used for backend web development. Typically developers will use the Django and Flask frameworks for Python and Spring for Java. Python is known for its code readability, meaning Python code is clean, readable, and concise. Python also has a large, comprehensive set of modules, packages, and libraries that exist beyond its standard library, developed by the community of Python enthusiasts. Java has a similar ecosystem, although perhaps to a lesser extent.

Mobile App Development

In terms of mobile app development, Java dominates the field, as it is the primary langauge used for building Android apps and games. Thanks to the aforementioned tailored libraries, developers have the option to write Android apps by leveraging robust frameworks and development tools built specifically for the operating system. Currently, Python is not used commonly for mobile development, although there are tools like Kivyand BeeWare that allow you to write code once and deploy apps across Windows, OS X, iOS, and Android.

Machine Learning and Big Data

Conversely, in the world of machine learning and data science, Python is the most popular language. Python is often used for big data, scientific computing, and artificial intelligence (A.I.) projects. The vast majority of data scientists and machine learning programmers opt for Python over Java while working on projects that involve sentiment analysis. At the same time, it is important to note that many machine learning programmers may choose to use Java while they work on projects related to network security, cyber attack prevention, and fraud detection.

Where to Start

When it comes to learning the foundations of programming, many studies have concluded that it is easier to learn Python over Java, due to Python‚Äôs simple and intuitive syntax, as seen in the earlier example. Java programs often have more boilerplate code - sections of code that have to be included in many places with little or no alteration - than Python. That being said, there are some notable advantages to Java, in particular its speed as a compiled language. Learning both Python and Java will give students exposure to two languages that lay their foundation on similar computer science concepts, yet differ in educational ways.

Overall, it is clear that both Python and Java are powerful programming languages in practice, and it would be advisable for any aspiring software developer to learn both languages proficiently. Programmers should compare Python and Java based on the specific needs of each software development project, as opposed to simply learning the one language that they prefer. In short, neither language is superior to another, and programmers should aim to have both in their coding experience.

PythonJava
Runtime PerformanceWinner
Ease of LearningWinner
Practical AgilityTieTie
Mobile App DevelopmentWinner
Big DataWinner

entry.title: The Graveyard Book
entry.content:
Amusement Park üé† Book

Children have no concept of life and death, and the cemetery is more like an amusement park for them

Thank you üôè üêº reader for sending another book

Ashamed, the number of readings plummeted after going abroad
From hundreds of books per year before suddenly to single digits now

Think about the boastful saying that reading should not be utilitarian, but should be driven by interest
Now it‚Äôs really slap in the face

But there are also objective reasons:

One is that most of the books I want to read now have original editions
Since there is the original version, I don‚Äôt really want to see the translated version

Second, there was a time when my phone call was heard by a friend from the National University of Singapore
After that, she repeatedly despised ‚ÄúYour Plastic English‚Äù

But I have my stubbornness, slow is slow, but I stick to the original version
There should be one day I can get up as fast as Chinese books

The third is that Po County is an island, and there is no such thing as the good mountains and rivers abroad, so lonely
And at the beginning of this epidemic, I once thought that this place was a developed country with papers.
In addition, it is summer all year round, except for the hotter, other things are quite comfortable
The blue sky and white clouds, heavy rain and thunder, feel like time is frozen, it‚Äôs good

Without utilitarianism, naturally there is no motivation to read

Circuit Breaker is now, so I have some time and mood

I got this book first
I thought it was science fiction at the beginning
I heard that I could be invisible and thought it was fantasy
I thought it was love when I met sister paper
Went to school and thought it was a campus
Dad came to the game and thought it was a parent-child
The whole family was killed and thought it was suspense
In the end, I was talking about growth

As the last author wrote:

I finished the sixth chapter, ‚ÄúBertie‚Äôs School Days‚Äù in a run-down hotel in New Orleans. I finished the last page in the gazebo in my garden, holding back tears while writing. Only at that moment, I understood why I didn‚Äôt write this book when I was a father. Because before creating, I have to accompany my children through their growth process, nurture them, love them, and finally learn to let go

In addition, it‚Äôs hard to get involved in the reading process
The whole book has always given me the feeling of a Harry Potter copy

But there is a significant difference in this reading
In the past, when reading such novels, I often entered the book from the perspective of the protagonist
With age
This time it‚Äôs more from Silas‚Äô perspective

If this book is a common fantasy routine in China
Bod will definitely pick up sister Scarlett, tame Sleer, become Master, tear Jack, sit as Brotherhood boss

However, all this did not happen in Neil, who wrote about the American Gods.
After Bod played the monster üëæ, the sister paper was scared off, and Bod is just an ordinary The world is so big, I want to see

As a father, do you want to see your Bod become the one in the country or the one in the book üìñ?

There are also some stupid things done during the rebellious period that require parents to pay for it
Now that I‚Äôm older, I understand the difficulties of my parents‚Äô various prohibitions.

But I can‚Äôt help thinking about it
I didn‚Äôt know what I knew now

I have imagined that if the self now and the self then
I would definitely not be obedient at that time
You must be hammered in the face by the iron fist of society to wake up
Do something resolutely

After dealing with the general affairs, one day he will step out of the fairy tale world and enter life

‚ÄúGood-bye, then, Silas.‚Äù Bod held out his hand, as he had when he was a small boy, and Silas took it, in a cold hand the color of old ivory, and shook it gravely.
‚ÄúGood-bye, Nobody Owens.‚Äù
Bod picked up the little suitcase. He opened the door to let himself out of the crypt, walked back up the gentle slope to the path without looking back.‚Äù

I was miserable when I came out, no one gave me away, no goodbye
The rent in Beijing was refunded and I bought a one-way ticket
All the belongings are packed in three suitcases
Take a taxi to the airport at 4 in the morning
After finishing the consignment, boarding, and then leaving

without looking back

How I wish I also heard Bod‚Äôs auditory hallucinations:

He took a step forward ‚Ä¶ a voice said, ‚ÄúI am so proud of you, my son.‚Äù

entry.title: How to reduce iCloud storage by shrink videos
entry.content:
When I gallery videos in Photos, it will show where and when did I take them

That is a wonderful feature to help me to recall my memory
But the original 4k takes too much space in iCloud

For example, a 2:30 video will take 1GB, even powered by HEVC (High-Efficiency Video Coding)
My 200G iCloud plan almost full

So I‚Äôm planning to compress videos a little bit to save some space.

But,

FFmpeg converts video will loss GPS even with metadata

Luckily, I found a way to do it

Tools

  • FFmpeg
  • Exiftool

Export original videos to a folder

The common way to drag videos from Photos to a folder will let Photos convert the video

So you have to select all your videos want to export and

File -> Export -> Export Unmodified Original For...

shrink each video

iPhone default Stream is
#0:0(und): Video: hevc (Main) (hvc1 / 0x31637668), yuv420p(tv, bt709)

so re-encoding to 10bit with -pix_fmt yuv420p10le does not help

Then you can copy & paste these code into Terminal and cd VideoFolder, then shrinkVideos

It will take a very long time to do the shrink

On my MacBook Pro (15-inch, 2018), it‚Äôs only 0.3x
But usually, the video will shrink 5x without losing too much quality

When all finished, shrunk videos will under shrunk/ folder

Then you can compare them, and delete original video first then import shrunk video

OK Finally I cannot bear the extremely slow speed, so I use my Nvidia 1080 GPU to accelerate, for more: CUDA GPU Accelerated h264/h265/HEVC Video Encoding with Staxrip

One more step is to tag the converted video to hvc1, otherwise, Photos will be imported with an error:

Invalid: The operation couldn‚Äôt be completed. (PHPhotosErrorDomain error -1.)

so the whole step is to

I hope this will be helpful to you

entry.title: How to auto-reply & send msg with telegram
entry.content:
There are many reasons as a man that you have to reply within 59 seconds, otherwise, some bad things will happen.

Luckily Telegram provides an API to do so.

  2. install telethon with pip3

  • run it on Ubuntu, working
  • finally found in here, Python crashing on macOS 10.15, OpenSSL missing

entry.title: Uber Booking Animation
entry.content:
In June this year, I was in San Jose to join WWDC, that‚Äôs the time I saw the waiting animation when I was using Uber to meet a friend at Cupertino Library.

The animation is awe-inspiring!

I‚Äôm so curious how they did it, so I do a little bit of exploration.

Preview

Well, the polyline animation still not smooth enough. Does anyone have a better idea?

Step by Step

Rotate Map

I chose Ô£øMap as the default map to demo because of two reasons:

  • After WWDC19, Simulator build on top of Meta, Core layer under all of Apple‚Äôs frameworks which MapKit included, Metal takes advantage of GPU of the underlying Mac system
  • Google Map need a developer key to get access, which means you cannot run it directly on the simulator after forking the repository from GitHub

Ô£øMap transactions can be tuned by embed in UIView.animate block.

Google Map has to use CATransaction

Pin Animation

We need two `CAShapeLayer‚Äôs to do the animation, one for circle, the other for the pin.
Notice that the circle disappears after it reaches to maximum, and the pin has an easeIn curve.

Draw Polyline on map

Ô£øMap use MKMapViewDelegate to handle drawing.

Here is how to add polyline

Animate Polyline

That‚Äôs the tricky part.

As we see Uber‚Äôs animation closely enough, the polyline rotating with the map, so that draws on the map.

What I do is continuing add and remove polylines on the map to pretend it‚Äôs an animation.
Also, the line has a header and a tail when appearing at the beginning and ending at the pin.

Here is the repository, if you have an any better idea, please let me know :)

Update

Well, As screen refresh rate is 60 fps, so it should make total steps/duration ‚âà 60

  4. Setup Emitter properties
  5. Drag actions you want to add on each Emitter

entry.title: React Native & Flutter
entry.content:
There are tons of pros and cons already.

ProsCons
React NativeHot Reloading
Online Hot Fixing
Front-End friendly
Cross platform
Fix once
JavaScript
Native UI knowledge on both platform
Debugging
FlutterFlutter Engine
Cross platform
Same UX & UI
Learn Dart
Unstable (1.0 released)
Ugly Code Style
iOS 13?
Debugging
NativeiOS Part
Much easier
AutoLayout, Storyboard
Swift, write less and do more
SpriteKit, UIDynamic		Three developers(fontend, iOS, android) triple budgets

As an iOS developer who is happily following Ô£ø steps, I‚Äôm using Swift, Storyboard, and AutoLayout at the very beginning when I dived into iOS dev.

I think that‚Äôs why most native developers don‚Äôt want to learn React Native even a bit üò£.

Two years ago, I built Mattermost and changed a few things in my previous company to replace Slack, that‚Äôs the first React Native project I touched.

The unhappy thing is it‚Äôs very easier to lost in code, and I have to search the whole project every time I want to change something, there is no Storyboard let me know who shows who.

I have a chat with my previous coworker, who is a Sr. front-end. He helped me launched the update server, which is also written in Node.js. I handover this project to him when I left.

According to him, it is that he doesn‚Äôt know how to write native code, as the React Native similar to React.js, why not to use it to try both iOS & Android. Then I asked if he knows how to swift, which tech will he prefer. You can guess the answer üòÑ.

Because from my side, sometimes features are hard to implement even in swift code, that‚Äôs absolutely a long way to achieve by another tech.

Then there is an opportunity to do a demo these days, which contains nested magnet scroll views, buttons, and navigations, Instead of using native code, I step out of my comfort zone and try React Native as well as Flutter.

  • Views
    • ListView, ScrollView, Labels, Texts, TextFields
  • Actions
    • Drag, Click, Scroll
    • Callback Block or Delegate on view events

So if you skilled any one of them, the rest is to Google how to implement it in that framework or read their manual.

React Native

The impressive thing in React Native is state

it can be achieved by didSet of a variable in Swift, and there are also many frameworks to do it say RxSwift, PromiseKit

Flutter

I used to curious that some apps UX quite like developed by native, but somehow feels weird. Now I know it‚Äôs flutter.

  • That‚Äôs the first time I write once and got two apps(I had so many troubles setting React Native with Android )
  • 0.9 has a bug on Hot reload
  • Dev on Visual Studio Code is pretty good, that remains me the old day writing Golang
  • ugly code style( are they serious üò† about it? that‚Äôs an official example)

Anyway, I‚Äôm really impressed it skip native components and written its own 2D rendering engine. That‚Äôs much genius than React Native.

So personally, I think Flutter has more potential than React Native. As well as there are so many companies roll back to native.

entry.title: CUDA GPU Accelerated h264/h265/HEVC Video Encoding with Staxrip
entry.content:
Games reformed my life.

Many cities I traveled to recent years, which once I have tours in Assassin‚Äôs creed series, sleeping dogs 2, GTA, and so on already.
It has a very impact when I really in there, in the real world. So every time I went back, always want to experience once in games.

But as I‚Äôm getting older and older and olderüë¥, I have less time to play it as beforeüë±.

I am recordingüìπ while playing üéÆ , which may be a good idea.

ShadowPlay

As I have a GIGABYTE Geforce GTX 1080 to train a deep learning model, so the only thing I need is Nvidia ShadowPlay, which is perfect for recording games.

But the minimal bitrate is 10Mbps, and I want to reduce it under 6kbps, so compression üóúÔ∏è involved.

Staxrip

I always use FFmpeg before but feel panic every time I heard the fan of my Macbooküíª noising, and it usually took all nightüåÉ to convert batch videos.

Fortunately, I saw the Cuda logo this time, which reminded the GPU accelerating.

Then I found staxrip, which is incredibleüëç.

  1. Click x264, choose NVIDIA H.265 ( I test on my 1080, it has a similar speed comparing with NVIDIA H.264, I use to thought 264 should much fast than 265 ), then it can use GPU to accelerate.
  2. Click Encoder Options, change the mode to VBR, then Video Bitrate appeared.

It can reach 250 frames/s with CPU 40%, GPU 35%.

entry.title: How to download videos concurrently from youtube and batch embed their subtitles
entry.content:
The whole thing I want to do is to download some courses which help me a lot on youtube and embed Zh-Hans subtitle to the video then submit them to a Chinese website which does not support external subtitle.

This thing may help the students in China who cannot speak English well and cannot access youtube.

Youtube-dl config

The file path is ~/.config/youtube-dl/config

Download concurrently

Batch translate filenames

After downloading all the videos in the list, get their names with

ls | grep mkv | sed "s/\.mkv//"

then copy & paste to google to get the translated text, then save it to a zh.txt

Batch embed subtitles

It usually took me a whole night for 20 videos on Intel Core i7, and an hour video needs 20 minutes to embed its subtitle.

entry.title: Rendezvous with Rama
entry.content:
I have admired the base series for a long time. This is the first Clark novel to be read completely.

Translation

Let me talk about translation

About two years ago, I had the original version and decided not to read the translation
I haven‚Äôt read it. Another earlier version met with Rama, so I didn‚Äôt post a comparison.
As far as this version is concerned, there is no imaginary sense of violation
As far as the name is concerned, Rama must be wrong, because the original text contains:

now they were working through the Gindu pantheon. And so 31/439 was christened Rama.

Cover

And I like this cover
When I first got the book, I thought it was a gravitational lens. I was completely misled. I didn‚Äôt expect it to be Rama.

Technology

On the whole, the only thing that feels wrong is the interstellar spacecraft, and the chimpanzee who does chores
Judging from the current level of technology, these things should be more like robots in Interstellar (you see, Rama civilization is also made by Jiangzi)
The human physiology described in the book has not improved much compared to now
It‚Äôs hard to imagine that humans are still like this when they move as far as Pluto (in the book, Pluto is still a planet rather than a dwarf planet).

You know, I felt like I was going to die when I went to Europe for an 11-hour flight. When I did this kind of interstellar travel, it was not a corpse anymore.

So if humans don‚Äôt iteratively upgrade as described in ‚ÄúLife 3.0‚Äù
Compared to humans, the humanoid robots in nier automata are more suitable for interstellar travel

Others are great
For example, although Rama‚Äôs intelligent life did not show up at the end, it is inferred that it should be similar to humans.
The mainstream view of science until now is that carbon-based life is because:

  1. Macromolecules need carbon and silicon as linkers
  2. Silicon needs extremely high temperatures to become active
  3. The carbon in the entire universe is 10 times that of silicon

Then Rama is the robot, which has specific functions, weak artificial intelligence, and does not need to be conscious

Rama people

The book is only in Liuli Shrine (I‚Äôm sorry I saw the glass and the temple was turned into a shrine ‚õ©Ô∏è) That chapter describes the creatures in the crystal, why guess that this is Rama‚Äôs advanced intelligent creature?

Because if you see a üì± in the universe, you will definitely not think that it was formed naturally, it must be created by some kind of intelligent life

Nuclear bomb from Mercury

When I saw it, I was worried about Rama being destroyed.
But to me, the Mercury people are not wrong, their speeches also make sense

If we pause here, treat it as a thought experiment
In the end, Rama really occupied the near-solar orbit. There was originally this opportunity to preserve human civilization. As a result, human civilization disappeared because of a person‚Äôs hypocrisy. The person who detonated the nuclear bomb was not a hero but a sinner.

Survival is the first need of civilization

In addition, for the human beings who have just stepped out of the solar system, there is no difference from the situation when they stepped out of Africa that year. When facing a dangerous environment again, how can they treat space in the way of modern civilization on Earth?

do not go gentle into that good night

However, from the perspective of Rama, where the sun is only 5 million kilometers behind, it opens the protective cover, absorbs energy, and violates Newton‚Äôs third law of position. It is not important whether the nuclear bomb is not important, but it highlights that it is actually a species-level struggle of humans.

Civilization

Human evolution has led to little conception of unusual sizes that cross daily levels

According to the description in the book, it is 50 kilometers long and 20 kilometers in diameter, so the circumference is 62.8 kilometers, so it seems that the entire inner wall area is 3,140 kilometers. What is the concept?

  • Three ten thousandths of our country
  • Beijing Sixth Ring Road 2,267 km¬≤
  • Shanghai 6,340 km¬≤
  • Shenzhen 2,050 km¬≤
  • Hong Kong 2,754 km¬≤

Feel it for yourself

Think about the current population of these cities, so such an area can fully carry the population base required by a human civilization
Not to mention the low gravity in the middle of Rama. Now the city skyscrapers are only a few hundred meters away. Rama is 10 kilometers away, which is two orders of magnitude worse. So the actual capacity
Not surface area but volume
Moreover, Rama should be just one of them, after all

Rama is the seventh avatar of the god Vishnu

The list of avatars in the Dashavatara varies by region: Matsya, Kurma, Varaha, Narasimha, Vamana, Parashurama, Rama, Krishna, Balarama and Kalki

entry.title: How to schedule iMessages on Mac
entry.content:
First open Terminal on your Mac and copy and paste these command lines as follows:

Send iMessage by Shell

You will see a file opened by your default text edit app and the file shows:

Notice that you should replace TEXT with the text you what to send and NAME with the name in your Contacts app.
Don‚Äôt forget to Save the file.

Crontab on mac

You should run this line above as the com.vix.cron will check the /etc/crontab is exist or not on macOS.
Type your password of the Mac.

Schedule the shell with Crontab

As the Crontab ‚Äì Quick Reference shows:

This shell means your Mac will send the iMessage on 10:00 Mar. 25.

Modify it to your ideal time then.

In the following step, you are using vim, and I think that is the hardest part.

  1. Press i, you will see -- INSERT -- on the left bottom of the Terminal
  2. Paste 00 10 25 3 * zsh ~/Documents/sendiMessage.sh
  3. Press shift + : then type wq , enter

Check Crontab

crontab -l

You can see 00 10 25 3 * zsh ~/Documents/sendiMessage.sh if everything was right.

entry.title: üáØüáµ-2-4-1
entry.content:
Tokyo

Imperial Palace

In fact, you can‚Äôt enter the royal residence. You can only see the back garden.

Ninomaru Garden

It‚Äôs still late March, so only some cherry blossoms üå∏ are in bloom.
‚Ä¶ with oranges üçä in the middle ‚Ä¶

lit. small bridges and flowing streams at home
There‚Äôs a little booth in the middle selling water and snacks, souvenirs.

National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo

Science Museum

The early days of cycling üö¥ were like a circus.
What a big diamond üíé
Shinkansen üöÑ wheels
pretend multi-dimensional space
It‚Äôs not a dizzy turntable.

I went back to the Mall and saw a lot of cats üê±.
The guy who runs the company would love to have one back.

Back at the hotel, I found bottled water in the shape of a Skytree.
I bought a pencil.
And the seasonal cherry blossom üå∏ Coke üòÇ
It‚Äôs much more normal than the one the stock market gods like.

National Museum of Nature and Science

I saw a lot of dinosaurs that I saw as a kid, the 100,000 Reasons Why, fossils.
Three of my favorites.

Tyrannosaurus ü¶ñ

Tyrannosaurus rex (scientific name: Tyrannosaurus rex), also known as Tyrannosaurus rex, is currently the only active species of Tyrannosaurus (Tyrannosaurus), belongs to the Tyrannosauridae giant beast-footed dinosaur, the name means ‚Äúthe tyrant of lizards‚Äù in Latin. It was estimated to have reached a length of up to 13 m[1], a hip height of about 4 m[2], and a weight averaging about 9 metric tons‚Ä¶. It had a bite force of nearly 6 metric tons, equivalent to the weight of an elephant[3].

Triceratops

Triceratops (genus name: Triceratops), commonly known as Triceratops, Triceratops, is a genus of Ornithischian Ceratosauridae, a species of plant-eating dinosaur. Triceratops was a medium-sized, quadrupedal dinosaur with a total length of 7 to 10 meters‚Ä¶. It is one of the last of all dinosaur species, and the largest and last of the ceratopsian dinosaurs, occupying most of the terrestrial ecosystem of the last period of non-ornithomorphic dinosaurs on Earth (Late Cretaceous).

Stegosaurus

Stegosaurus is one of the most famous dinosaurs to appear in books, comics, TV or movies, and is a very famous representative of phytophagous dinosaurs; however, Stegosaurus did not live in the same era as Tyrannosaurus and Triceratops (Stegosaurus in the Jurassic, Triceratops and Tyrannosaurus in the Cretaceous), Stegosaurus‚Äô main enemies were Allosaurus, Barbarian and Lizard-eating dinosaurs.

Trilobite

The earliest appeared in the Cambrian, peaked in the early Paleozoic, and thereafter declined to extinction. The last of the trilobites (Calyptera) disappeared in the extinction of a cluster of organisms at the end of the Permian, 250 million years ago.

And‚Ä¶ whales üê≥.
Elephants üêò Family History

Museum of Mankind

It‚Äôs not easy to feel the evolution of mankind in this long time.
A replica of the lucky one from the textbook is right in front of us, only about a meter away.
Living in a house made of bones.
By the time the old humans are taller than me.

Today, all humans belong to a single group: Homo sapiens sapiens, with no species distinction. However, according to the ‚Äúout-of-Africa‚Äù model, this was not the first species of the genus Homo: the first species of the genus Homo, ‚ÄúHomo sapiens‚Äù, evolved at least two million years ago, and Homo sapiens lived in different regions of Africa for a relatively short period of time. ‚ÄúHomo erectus‚Äù evolved more than 1.8 million years ago and by 1.5 million years ago had spread throughout the old world.

Red giant (star)

Combined with just the huge diamond üíé , it comes to a question of whether one should buy a diamond ring
as is generally known

There are three known isomers of carbon: diamond, graphite and fullerenes. Thermodynamically, diamond is less stable than graphite** can spontaneously transform into graphite**, but the rate of this transformation is negligibly slow at room temperature and pressure, which is why diamond üíé is stable. Naturally formed diamonds are generally formed in the high temperature and pressure environment of the Earth‚Äôs interior, and later brought to the surface by geological tectonic movements such as volcanic eruptions, which is why many diamonds are found near volcanoes. Modern industry can produce diamonds at high temperatures and pressures, known as synthetic diamonds

That‚Äôs why diamond rings have no purpose other than to show off by blinding others.
Not to mention the fact that the magnifying glass in the sun will evaporate.

And heavy metals like gold and platinum.

The atomic number of gold is high among the naturally occurring elements in the universe. This heavy element is believed to have been produced in supernova nucleosynthesis during the collision of two neutron stars,[4] and was present in the dust before the formation of the solar system. Since the Earth was still in a melting state at the time of its formation, almost all of the early Earth‚Äôs gold had sunk into the Earth‚Äôs core. Thus, much of the gold in the Earth‚Äôs crust and mantle now owes its existence to asteroid impact events during the later heavy bombardment period (about 4 billion years ago)
Gold has been a popular precious metal for money, hedges, jewelry and works of art for as long as recorded history. In the 1970s, with the end of the Bretton Woods Agreement, the gold standard finally gave way to a legal tender system worldwide. However, because of its rarity, easy melting, processing and minting, unique color, corrosion resistance, difficult to react with other substances and other characteristics, the value of gold does not decline.

lit. one‚Äôs superior can clearly see who is stronger

Of course it‚Äôs not a bad deal.
Only with a girlfriend to marry, of course.

gravitational wave

A gravitational wave detector (English: gravitational-wave observatory) is a device used in gravitational-wave astronomy to detect gravitational waves. Gravitational waves are ripples in space-time created by an accelerating mass. Albert Einstein first introduced the concept of gravitational waves in 1916. [1] By detecting gravitational waves, the theory of general relativity can be verified experimentally. Since the 1960s, several gravitational-wave detectors have been built and commissioned, and there have been advances in detector sensitivity.

And various animal models
There‚Äôs a giant blue whale outside the museum.

Ueno Zoo

Every time I‚Äôve been to the zoo, the Tiger House is either under renovation or about to close.
Finally, a tiger.
Gorilla with turban.
I accidentally looked at each other and saw the eyes
Instant chill down my spine, thinking of Planet of the Apes.

Anteaters or?
It turns out I‚Äôd met a kangaroo before I left for Australia.

See the closing, then go back.
Passing by the My wife bridge.
See that little yellow cloud or ice cream you saw on the Skytree last time?

Return

The next day, after checkout, take the Narita Airport Line back to the airport.
The lady asked if she was alone when she picked up the tickets.
I don‚Äôt know why it‚Äôs still hurting single people here.

Then the lady was pleased to inform.
We‚Äôve upgraded you to business class.
Welcome to JAL Japan Airlines in the future.

It turns out that the airline company randomly selects some customers for upgrade.

Lucky

This upgrade is limited to business class on the plane.
Unlike ANA, which paid for itself before.
Access to first class lounge with shower room

Of course, business class is as comfortable as ever.
I slept on the plane.
And that was the end of a 10-day trip to Japan.

entry.title: üáØüáµ-2-4-0
entry.content:
Tokyo

Tokyo Skytree

It was already noon when I arrived in Tokyo
This time I stayed at the Richmond Hotel next to it, the room is as always small + exquisite
Across the road is the clear sky tree
The hotel‚Äôs special restaurant is actually Sizzler, a frequent visitor in Beijing

When I came last time, I went up and took a look. At that time, there was the theme of Attacking Giant, but unfortunately I didn‚Äôt know the Captain.

Also because of the short time, I didn‚Äôt realize that there was a huge mall below.

After a nap, I woke up in the evening üåÜ, I went to the mall for a stroll

I found that I was doing Harry Potter‚Äôs theme

There are many more Pokemon
Because I have only seen the special Pokemon, I only know the first generation of Pokemon
Jenny Turtle, Fat Ding, Wonder Frog Tadpole, Gauss, Little Fire Dragon, Fast Dragon, Pikachu, Kabimon, etc.

What anime is the last one? Love Live! Sunshine? then what?

Tokyo DisneySea

üáØüáµ Said to be the only DisneySea theme park in the world
So I didn‚Äôt go to the Disney park next to it

Titanic, volcano üåã, temple üõï

But it was raining
Although the staff is still enthusiastic to create an atmosphere
But can‚Äôt stand the swish weather
Refreshing

Plus no express ticket
Popcorn üçøÔ∏è It takes an hour to line up
Other projects like bumper boats for two hours

Turn around
Came out

Very poor experience
Far, far, far less fun than the Universal Studio in Osaka last time

I thought Disney could play for a day
The result came out at 10 o‚Äôclock
Too embarrassing, I can only just walk around

Tokyo Sea Life Park

I thought it was an observatory from a distance
Big face, are you smiling üòÇ
And little penguin

National Museum of Emerging Science and Innovation

BSOD, AI Horror Valley, Fetus

I came out and found a boat next to me üö¢
If you look closely, it turned out to be a building, a ship‚Äôs science museum
Unfortunately it‚Äôs closed

The ball in the middle of the building behind is the planetarium

Odaiba Statue of Liberty Replica

Keep going around
Seen from afar üëÄ, wait, is that the Statue of Liberty üóΩ? ? ?
The one behind is the Golden Gate Bridge? ? ?

I walked in and took a look, really‚Ä¶
My mind üß† flashed the Gilgamesh sentence faker

Replicas of the Statue of Liberty

The French Statue of Liberty from the √éle aux Cygnes came to Odaiba, Tokyo, from April 1998 to May 1999 in commemoration of ‚ÄúThe French year in Japan‚Äù.[3] Because of its popularity, in 2000 a replica of the French Statue of Liberty was erected at the same place. Also in Japan, a small Statue of Liberty is in the Amerika-mura (American Village) shopping district in Osaka, Japan. Another replica is in Oirase[71] near the town of Shimoda south of Misawa in Aomori Prefecture, where the United States has an 8,000-person U.S. Air Force base. A replica of the Statue of Liberty in Ishinomaki, Miyagi Prefecture, was damaged by the 2011 T≈çhoku earthquake and tsunami.[72] There is also a replica in Oyabe, Toyama.[73]

That‚Äôs it

Gundam

Wow

Remember to watch Gundam Seed or borrow a disc from a classmate üë®‚Äçüéì when I was in high school üíΩ secretly watch at home
A few years ago, there was a remake, but I haven‚Äôt seen it before, after all
My youth is over

I can‚Äôt remember the plot or something now
Just remember Kira‚Äôs freedom Gundam
Single machine breaks through the atmosphere
Cut a lot of sticks
Then flew away

But this one in front of Uniqlo
See halo and corner
This should be a unicorn ü¶ÑÔ∏è
Fortunately, I watched the UC movie later, Laplace‚Äôs undead or something, otherwise I don‚Äôt know it again

There are Garage Kit in the shop next to it

entry.title: Programming Assignment: Scrooge Coin
entry.content:
This is the worst assignment I ever had.

The TxHandler.java cannot build and run, and everything has to guess. As I‚Äôm not familiar with JAVA, I met millions of grammar errors after submit.

I have to:

  • import packages by manually
  • add ; after each line
  • () after if
  • declare the type of a variable

That‚Äôs why I hate JAVA üò°üò°üò°.

entry.title: Neural Networks Representation
entry.content:
Neural Networks Representation

1.3 Vectorizing Logistic Regression

All right, I already used the Vectorized approach and without any loops last exercise.

1.4 One-vs-all Classification

the key points here are:

  • for is needed here to loop from 1 to num_labels
  • all_theta should assigned with (i,:), otherwise it will be a one-dimensional vector.

1.4.1 One-vs-all Prediction

the max function will return a two-dimensional vector, m is the value, and p is the max index in that row.

2 Neural Networks

Finally, I touched the Neural Networks with so many classes after. üò≥

The are trained to predict.

Before this, I wondering what is the process of prediction with a trained model. Is it the same with the training process?

Amazing ha! ü§©

First I forgot to sigmoid the hidden layer and output layer. The Accuracy shows

Training Set Accuracy: 69.62

And it will get the same accuracy if the output layer has no sigmoid . It also happened in the previous One-vs-all Prediction.

Therefore I still have the question. üßê

It‚Äôs time to keep on the training part. üí™

entry.title: Batch replace NamedColors to RGB in Storyboard
entry.content:
Updates: 2018-04-15

As the Xcode updated to 9.3, the NamedColors will cause an error instead of a warning; the shell doesn‚Äôt have to much value.

And there is a fast way to do it by click the color in Storyboard and touch the Hex Color # say ‚ÄúFFFFFF‚Äù after you chose the NamedColor.

NamedColors is a new feature that convenient for developers to use in Xcode
But it is only available on iOS 11, and it will cause app crash on iOS 10, 9‚Ä¶

The main idea is:

  • Use NamedColors in StoryBoard to avoid fill color every time to benefit the new feature.
  • Replace all NamedColors‚Äô attributes to RGB in StoryBoard when building the project to prevent crash on an old iOS version.

Then, Xcode -> Project File -> Build Phases -> Add Build Phase -> Add Run Script

If you found any way to reverse it back to NamedColors, please leave a msg to me.

After all, once the NamedColors changed, all the color in the interface builder should be changed too.

entry.title: Building Apps for iPhone X
entry.content:
First, Watching Building Apps for iPhone X with 2x speed to get a glance, it will speed 13/2 minutes.

  • The critical point is to open the Safe Area in Storyboard.
  • The LayoutConstraint attracted to Superview can beyond the Safe Area.

My current app has 17 Storyboards and 28 ViewControllers.

In each ViewController, the previous developers used an UIView on top to cover the system‚Äôs navigationController to do some tricks, which means the constraint of the view has a height == 64, and top == superview.top.

Although it‚Äôs a little disgusting, it works on previous devices in which the navigation bar‚Äôs height is always 64.

But on iPhone X, it needs to use Safe Area. Which means I have better to delete the fake navigation view. But that means it moves all the buttons, actions, animations to the system‚Äôs navigationController if the segue kind is push.

Honestly, to say, it‚Äôs much easier than I thought after all the works are done.

For the segue kind is present modally, the fake view still does its job by changed it‚Äôs height only if the device is iPhone X.

Other useful tools

entry.title: üáÆüáπ-0-1
entry.content:
Naples (Molo Immacolatella Vecchia)

In the evening, leave Naples and go to Palermo by boat

The suspended lifebuoy and lifeboat can not help but remind people of the Titanic

In fact, this ship is much bigger than the Titanic
Can handle the entire parking lot next to the car
In the calm Mediterranean again, there are no icebergs, don‚Äôt worry about sinking ships
You can also see this huge cruise ship on Google Map
The cabin is small but has a separate toilet, and can also be hot and rainy

The shaking cabin and the siren are very hypnotic

entry.title: üáÆüáπ-0-0
entry.content:
I came back from Japan üáØüáµ less than three months ago in time for the National Day holiday.

Because I got an American empire visa and a three-year round-trip visa to Japan.
Keep the pile of materials ready.
So the Schengen visa wasn‚Äôt a big deal.

Rome

11 hours on Alitalia from the capital to Rome üá∑üá¥.

Sorrento

Unlike the usual first flight north to Italy.
Rome - Florence - Milan - Venice Route

Partners operate in reverse.
Take the little train all the way south to Sorrento.

That little hill in the distance must be Vesuvius.

Pompeii

Largely preserved under the ash, the excavated city offered a unique snapshot of Roman life, frozen at the moment it was buried, and an extraordinarily detailed insight into the everyday life of its inhabitants, although much of the evidence was lost in the early excavations. It was a wealthy town, enjoying many fine public buildings and luxurious private houses with lavish decorations, furnishings and works of art which were the main attractions for the early excavators. Organic remains, including wooden objects and human bodies, were entombed in the ash and decayed leaving voids which archaeologists found could be used as moulds to make plaster casts of unique and often gruesome figures in their final moments of life. The numerous graffiti carved on the walls and inside rooms provide a wealth of examples of the largely lost Vulgar Latin spoken colloquially at the time, contrasting with the formal language of the classical writers.
Pompeii is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and is one of the most popular tourist attractions in Italy, with approximately 2.5 million visitors annually.

Eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 AD

Around 1:00 PM, Mount Vesuvius violently erupted, spewing up a high-altitude column from which ash and pumice began to fall, blanketing the area. Rescues and escapes occurred during this time. At some time in the night or early the next day, pyroclastic flows in the close vicinity of the volcano began. Lights seen on the mountain were interpreted as fires. People as far away as Misenum fled for their lives. The flows were rapid-moving, dense, and very hot, wholly or partly knocking down all structures in their path, incinerating or suffocating the remaining population and altering the landscape, including the coastline. These were accompanied by additional light tremors and a mild tsunami in the Bay of Naples. By evening of the second day, the eruption was over, leaving only haze in the atmosphere through which the sun shone weakly.
Pliny the Younger wrote an account of the eruption:
Broad sheets of flame were lighting up many parts of Vesuvius; their light and brightness were the more vivid for the darkness of the night‚Ä¶ it was daylight now elsewhere in the world, but there the darkness was darker and thicker than any night.

Great Theatre of Pompeii

The theatre area of Pompeii is located in the southwest region of the city. There are three main buildings that make up this area: the Large Theatre, the Odeon (small theatre), and the Quadriporticum. This served as an entertainment and meeting center of the city.
The Large Theatre was built into a natural hill in the second century BC. This theatre sat roughly 5,000 spectators and is one of the original permanent stone theatres to stand in Rome.
The theatre has been used for concerts, operas, and theatre in modern times. In 2008, a restoration effort began to allow for further theatrical and musical performances. Upon reopening, productions of Puccini‚Äôs La boheme and Bizet‚Äôs Carmen took place in 2014.

As far as the black clouds of the volcano. üåã
It‚Äôs hard to imagine lava covering this area.

Amphitheatre of Pompeii

Built around 70 BC, the current amphitheatre is the earliest Roman amphitheatre known to have been built of stone; previously, they had been built out of wood.
Aside from being a historical landmark and an object of archaeological study, the amphitheatre has been used for concerts and other public events in modern times.

Mount Vesuvius

It is one of several volcanoes which form the Campanian volcanic arc. Vesuvius consists of a large cone partially encircled by the steep rim of a summit caldera caused by the collapse of an earlier and originally much higher structure.

The eruption of Mount Vesuvius in AD 79 destroyed the Roman cities of Pompeii, Herculaneum, Oplontis and Stabiae, as well as several other settlements. ultimately releasing 100,000 times the thermal energy released by the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki.
Vesuvius has erupted many times since, and is the only volcano on the European mainland to have erupted within the last hundred years. Today, it is regarded as one of the most dangerous volcanoes in the world because of the population of 3,000,000 people living near enough to be affected by an eruption, with 600,000 in the danger zone, making it the most densely populated volcanic region in the world, as well as its tendency towards violent, explosive eruptions of the Plinian type.

Vesuvius was formed as a result of the collision of two tectonic plates, the African and the Eurasian. The former was subducted beneath the latter, deeper into the earth. As the water-saturated sediments of the oceanic African plate were pushed to hotter depths inside the planet, the water boiled off and lowered the melting point of the upper mantle enough to partially melt the rocks. Because magma is less dense than the solid rock around it, it was pushed upward. Finding a weak spot at the Earth‚Äôs surface, it broke through, thus forming the volcano.

The area around Vesuvius was officially declared a national park on 5 June 1995.[71] The summit of Vesuvius is open to visitors and there is a small network of paths around the volcano that are maintained by the park authorities on weekends. There is access by road to within 200 metres (660 ft) of the summit (measured vertically), but thereafter access is on foot only. There is a spiral walkway around the volcano from the road to the crater.

I thought it was a hillbilly.
It‚Äôs quite big, about 1km above sea level.

As told above
Do the bus ride up the mountain, the last part of the slope you have to walk up by yourself.
Better wear tight shoes, or it‚Äôs all volcanic ash.

There‚Äôs no lava inside the crater, but there‚Äôs some smoke coming out of it.

Some of these clouds look like they‚Äôre being held up neatly underneath.
Some of them come in my face now and then.
It‚Äôs reminiscent of the Arrival movie where the clouds drift over the mountains.
I‚Äôm really standing in the clouds this time.

Positano

Positano is a dreamland, she wasn‚Äôt quite real when you were there, she came to life after you left.

This little house on the hill is just weird. It‚Äôs the perfect place for parkour.
Once upon a time, when we played Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Ezio was climbing over a wall in Italy.

There‚Äôs a small boat at the beach.

It was night when I got back.
The lights are like a movie set.

The Tyndall effect is light scattering by particles in a colloid or in a very fine suspension. Also known as Tyndall scattering, it is similar to Rayleigh scattering(Aldnoah Zero), in that the intensity of the scattered light is inversely proportional to the fourth power of the wavelength, so blue light is scattered much more strongly than red light.

It‚Äôs like the Lord of the Rings.

Capri

As well as being a haven for writers and artists, Capri served as a relatively safe place for foreign gay men and lesbians to lead a more open life; a small nucleus of them were attracted to live there, overlapping to some extent with the creative types mentioned above.

The boat will go around for about an hour.
It‚Äôs a shame the boys have to go back early to catch their flight.
So it‚Äôs only 1/2 way around and then we‚Äôre back.

Blue Grotto (Capri)

As light passes through the water into the cave, red reflections are filtered out and only blue light enters the cave. Objects placed in the water of the grotto famously appear silver. This is caused by tiny bubbles, which cover the outside of the object when they are placed underwater. The bubbles cause the light to refract differently than it does from the surrounding water and gives off the silver effect.
In part because of the dazzling effect of the light from the above-water opening, the water in the cave is more light-filled than the air. A visitor who places a hand in the water can see it ‚Äúglow‚Äù eerily in this light.

The dinghy guy and we were introduced to the bluest blue hole on the island.
believe sth to be true
In the evening, I went back and listened to the financial director of the tour across the sea in Spain, who also said that he had seen the bluest blue hole.

Tell her she must have been tricked.
After all, the blue holes are only

  • Blue Grotto (Bi≈°evo), a cave on the Croatian island of Bi≈°evo
  • Blue Grotto (Capri), a cave on the Italian island of Capri
  • Blue Cave (Kastelorizo), a cave on the Greek Island of Megisti (Kastelorizo)
  • Blue Grotto (Malta), a cave in Malta
  • Blue Grotto, an area under the Manhattan end of the Brooklyn Bridge
  • Grotta dello Smeraldo, a cave at the Amalfi Coast in Italy

Blue Mediterranean

Unlike the Pacific Blue we‚Äôve seen in California before.
This Mediterranean blue is like a thick dye.

Being nearly landlocked affects conditions in the Mediterranean Sea: for instance, tides are very limited as a result of the narrow connection with the Atlantic Ocean. The Mediterranean is characterised and immediately recognised by its deep blue colour.

Yoyogi Park

Yoyogi Park stands on the site from where the first successful powered aircraft flight in Japan took place by Captain Yoshitoshi Tokugawa on 19 December 1910. The area later became an army parade ground. From September 1945, the site housed the military barracks known as the ‚ÄúWashington Heights‚Äù for U.S. officers during the Allied occupation of Japan.
In 2014, Tokyo experienced one of its worst dengue fever outbreaks in 100 years and the first recorded cases in 70 years, with nearly 200 confirmed cases.

I didn‚Äôt realize there was an outbreak of dengue fever.

When we used to go out, we‚Äôd always take a 1.5L arterial.
There are vending machines everywhere in Japan, so there‚Äôs no need to bring water.
The only awkward thing is that there are no bins, so you have to hold the bottle when you‚Äôre done and expect the next vending machine to have a recycling bin!

WC also offers LGBT üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà

The sea cockroach‚Ä¶

üê† ü¶û ü¶ë

Tokyo Skytree

It‚Äôs not just a tower for heights and attractions, it‚Äôs a radio station.

The tower is the primary television and radio broadcast site for the Kant≈ç region; the older Tokyo Tower no longer gives complete digital terrestrial television broadcasting coverage because it is surrounded by high-rise buildings. Skytree was completed on Leap Day, 29 February 2012
Tokyo Skytree also resembles a 5-storey pagoda from historical Japan.[11] The base of the tower has a structure similar to a tripod; from a height of about 350 m (1,150 ft) and above, the tower‚Äôs structure is cylindrical to offer panoramic views of the river and the city.[12] There are observatories at 350 m (1,150 ft), with a capacity of up to 2,000 people, and 450 m (1,480 ft), with a capacity of 900 people.[13] The upper observatory features a spiral, glass-covered skywalk in which visitors ascend the last 5 meters to the highest point at the upper platform. A section of glass flooring gives visitors a direct downward view of the streets below.[
The tower has seismic proofing, including a central shaft made of reinforced concrete. The main internal pillar is attached to the outer tower structure for the first 125 meters (410 ft) above ground. From there until 375 meters (1,230 ft) the pillar is attached to the tower frame with oil dampers, which act as cushions during an earthquake. Additional resilience is achieved through an ‚Äúadded mass control mechanism‚Äù (or tuned mass damper) ‚Äì a damping system which, in the event of an earthquake, moves out of step with the building‚Äôs structure, to keep the center of gravity as central as possible to the tower‚Äôs base.[15] According to the designers, the dampers can absorb 50 percent of the energy from an earthquake.

Fear of heights.
I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôm hallucinating.

They say they‚Äôre not afraid.
shiver with fear
Go up and keep your body close to the inside.

The glass floor at the highest point is fine. It‚Äôs a little unreal.
A tentative tread. ü¶∂

It really hurts not having a trash can. üòÇ

Looked out the window.
A time of peace and quiet.

100,000 of yen üí¥, and it‚Äôs all gone.

Fruits, milk, drinks, bread, cakes, unlimited supply.
üçâ ü•õ ü•§ üçû üç∞

Because we‚Äôve had enough in the lounge.
I have to sleep flat. üí§

And that was the end of this first short trip to Japan. üáØüáµ

I like the cleanliness and orderliness of Japan.
The shoes are as good as new until they leave.

Three-year round-trip visa

entry.title: How to trust MitM Certificate on iPhone Simulator
entry.content:
Open Keychain and export the MitM Root certificate as .cer ( not .p12 ), drag it to the simulator, then go to Settings.General.About.CertificateTrustSettings.ENABLE FULL TRUST FOR ROOT CERTIFICATES, open the Switch which is your MitM.

Before that, I dragged .p12, and it can trusted in Settings.General.Profiles, but can‚Äôt be see in Settings.General.About.Certificate Trust Settings.

This wasted lots of time, and I found something like: Modify TrustStore.sqlite3

That is terrible. There it no need to say the TrustStore.sqlite3 no longer in at that path.

After read Installing a CA‚Äôs Root Certificate on Your Test Device and found nothing.

I‚Äôm glad tried .cer several days later, now I can watch all requests on specific domains by Surge.

entry.title: Softwares speed up your learning
entry.content:
Podcasts and videos are a typical way to study online, but they are numberless and as the collect is in human‚Äôs nature, how to increase this speed become more essential.

Typically, people can deal with native languages at a high speed.
As for me, 2x is comfortable, 3x is acceptable, 4x is fine with subtitle.

Desktop

A few years ago, I used to use Windows when I was still a university student, KMPlayer was the best in all type of video players, because other players may got distorted sound while changing. Later, the author left the company and rewrote a new one with C++ and renamed it to PotPlayer.

As on macOS, Movist is my first choice, which is also come from Korea. needless to say its brilliance and simplicity, it provide 4x without too much losses in audio track.
Other players like MPV, although it provide no rate limit( yes, you can speed up to whatever you like) and open sourced, but you have to modify ~/.config/mpv/mpv.conf each time if you want to change the default settings.

Mobile

The good news is Podcasts on iPhone already have 2x (the odd thing is iTunes Podcasts don‚Äôt), and many study type apps also have this useful feature.

But I haven‚Äôt found any app provide more than 2x.

According to Ô£ø

It seems merely change the player.rate = 3.0 can do it if the audio is a file-based media. Dose this would cause distortion?

I‚Äôll try it if I spare time one day.

entry.title: Swift Generics in protocol and enum
entry.content:
• protocol can only be used as a generic constraint because it has Self or associated type requirements
  • Protocols do not allow generic parameters; use associated types instead
  • cannot specialize non-generic type

entry.title: Custom UIViewController Presentation Transitions with UIStoryboardSegue
entry.content:
The most popular way is UIViewControllerAnimatedTransitioning

In order to do so, you have to:

  • New a subclass which may called XXXTransitioning inherit from NSObject and implement two functions of protocol UIViewControllerAnimatedTransitioning
  • Then:
    1. New an instance of the XXXTransitioning in the ViewController
    2. Set transitioningDelegate = self
    3. Extension the ViewController with UIViewControllerTransitioningDelegate and implement
  • Do it again for dismiss

I noticed Storyboard Segue has a Custom Kind

That‚Äôs it, no more coding delegate and Extension. Simple and clean :)

entry.title: How to add Xib on StoryBoard
entry.content:
In the classic 1975 software project management book, The Mythical Man Month: Essays on Software Engineering, Fred Brooks states that, no matter the programming language chosen, a professional developer will write an average 10 lines of code (LoC) day.

StoryBoard is good for saving code lines and improve efficiency, as Ô£ø strongly recommend in each WWDC and continually improve it.

I don‚Äôt understand why there are still lots of Team Leaders require their poor programmers to write the UIView in programmatic way.

Maybe they thought some CustomViews are highly reuse usable, and cope paste in StoryBoard would cause the redundant side effect.

So, The main idea of this solution is, cohesion the CustomViews to a Xib then add it on StoryBoard.

This need a few steps as for Ô£ø didn‚Äôt support it directly:

  1. add a IBDesignable CustomView.Swift and CustomView.Xib
  2. set the CustomView.xib -> Placeholders -> File's Owner -> Custom Class to CustomView
  3. new a CustomView programmatically and load the root view from CustomView.Xib
  4. add the root view with equal width and height in both horizontal and vertical center on CustomView in init function
  5. now you can drag a View to StoryBoard, and set it‚Äôs class to CustomView which can generate a snapshot for preview

But the subviews of CustomView like UIButton can‚Äôt wire to ViewController as an @IBOutlet

Delegate or Block can solve this problem.

As for me, I suggest Block way, cause I used Delegate for half a year, and found

  • ViewController will have too many delegates
  • delegate = self have to written in viewDidLoad and sometimes =nil in viewDidDisappear

Block will have less code and more simpler.

Here is the example which may reduce your time.

entry.title: How to learn English as a Chinese
entry.content:
I hate remember words in a brutal way as 99% of Chinese students does. When we were kid, we learned our mother tongue natural without any pain.

So when I was in my poor primary school, I never remember a word.

In fact, the truth is I can‚Äôt remember words. Believe it or not, no matter how hard I tried, I just can‚Äôt remember them. Each time it‚Äôs my row‚Äôs turn to write words on blackboard, I had to watch left and right carefully and copied each character one by one.

As a teenager at that time, I‚Äôm curious that why they can do it. It must be the method incompatible with my brain.

Fortunately, I read another method on a gramma book that a former top scorer announced that she did not remember words either. All she was doing is repeat NCE 100+ times loudly.

Hum, that‚Äôs great, so I tried it and this method helps me a lot, for it let me got a fair score in college entrance examination and passed the CET6 in university, even I did know what I‚Äôm reading sometimes.

Until IELTS, all the English tests early were merely a joke.

And there is another blind spot I realised recently, exam is exam, one should get the point and leave ASAP.

Before that, I firmly believed that as long as my true level raise, I will be capable of the exam with no extra effort like do the test paper everyday.

But in fact, this required a very high quality far more than the exam required, this is an endless road.

14 years passed after first time I got to know English, I feel I just make one little step after I communicated with the resident a few month ago.

Now I know the language is more like an instinct of mankind, when baby grow up, the neurone cells will be cleaned by our brain cause there is no use for our ancestors to learn another language when they were kids, according to evolutionary psychology.

But we are in modern world, as far as I know, there is only two methods which sound reasonable, and more importantly, economic.

  3. ESLPOD
  4. American Accent Training
  5. Read at least 10 original edition books per year

entry.title: Sync macOS ssh config with iCloud
entry.content:
As a developer, I have to restore backups sometime because of the beta system.

Fortunately, most data was on the server these days. Not only Safari, Photos, Calendar, Note, Reminders, but also other apps use iCloud storage. That was significant progress. I only have to re-download apps from App Store and brew shell after reinstalling the system.

But the setting of ssh, configs, etc., was annoying. Furthermore, I may lose my private keys.

So I new a folder which named macOS in iCloud Drive folder, and copied all the files without ., For example, .gitconfig ~> gitconfig

Any cloud drive (like Dropbox) can do it, but
considering privacy and this letter A Message to Our Customers written by Tim Cook

iCloud was my choice üòä

entry.title: Use AppleScript as AutoHotkey On Mac
entry.content:
For the good test of Soylent 1.6, I bought 20+ boxes recently.
But there was a problem that Safari does not support AutoFill Form in that website. So I have to input full informations of my credit card manually for the transport fee and the tariff.

All the payment steps are merely number, date, cvv, password.

I was broke down after repeated it again and agin.

It should be automated.

For God‚Äôs sake, it occurred to me that the AutoHotkey when I was still using Windows four years ago.

Mac has the AppleScript which can simulate keyboard input and mouse click.

And I found an interesting thing in this process which is the cvv can‚Äôt be clicked by the script.

It seems the bank‚Äôs website really do something on security.

entry.title: Nothing To Say
entry.content:
It‚Äôs been a long time that I didn‚Äôt write anything. Maybe written in English fully is the obstacle.

Too many things happened in these two months.

First, my company failed in series D funding round.

Our CTO had to reduce the design apartment‚Äôs programmers by more than a third and reduce three apps to one. Almost half of the programmers were leave. It seems everything went back to B round happy time.
But, something never went back again.

My project iterated to version 1.6 and be cut. So, there is no more coding job, after that, I went to San Francisco to join WWDC16.

Second, Do what you love.

So, programming is my job, exact to iOS developer after my gap year.

I subscribed many Tech blog when I were work in the beginning, but they never rose my attention again. At the same time, I lost every interest of everything, and don‚Äôt want to meet anyone.

It may I have no real hobby cause that, the only former interest was programming.

But finally, I have a little luxury time to relax myself both physically and mentally after I went to Beijing two years ago which was the most suffocating super city in the world.

Third, I did resize how important of the excise when I came back from SFO. Almost every elitist do excise in developed country.

After I did see the blue sky every where, the wide of Pacific Ocean, the green leaf in the sunshine, the house on the hill covered in mist.
I know there is a real better world in the world which is waiting for me.
Keep myself heathy is in top priority, all other things are secondary.
