entry.title: üá∫üá∏-0-1
entry.content:
USA-0-1

Badge

The next day, Bill Graham Civic Auditorium.
Produce your passport for Badge.

Pictured next to San Francisco City Hall

San Francisco City Hall is the seat of government for the City and County of San Francisco, California. Re-opened in 1915 in its open space area in the city‚Äôs Civic Center, it is a Beaux-Arts monument to the City Beautiful movement that epitomized the high-minded American Renaissance of the 1880s to 1917. The structure‚Äôs dome is taller than that of the United States Capitol by 42 feet.

You‚Äôll need to paint Badge to get into the venue in the next few days.

If you lose it, well‚Ä¶ That‚Äôs too bad. Apple won‚Äôt pay for it.

And an ugly jacket at the same time.
I don‚Äôt understand why they don‚Äôt issue t shirts instead of jackets in this heat.

Then I understood the peculiarities of San Francisco‚Ä¶ and died in the sun.
In the shadows, the sea breeze blows and shivers again.
That‚Äôs why that ugly jacket served such an important purpose.

When I passed by again at night, the venue was LGBT.

LGBT üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà

Noticed early on that there were little flags hanging around the perimeter, and at first just thought it was funny and inertia wondering why it wasn‚Äôt an American flag!
T, flying in from another state, said it was LGBT.
And there will be The SF LGBT Parade and Celebration at the end of the month

The San Francisco Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender Pride Celebration (formerly International Lesbian & Gay Freedom Day, Gay Freedom Day, Christopher Street West), usually known as San Francisco Pride, is a parade and festival held at the end of June each year in San Francisco, California, to celebrate the lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender (LGBT) people and their allies. The 49th annual parade in 2019 included 289 parade contingents, and is described on the official website as ‚Äúthe largest gathering of LGBT people and allies in the nation‚Äù.

Later on, Miss T said she had a girlfriend.
The little mage who had been single for 10,000 years was silent for a long time.

Lombard Street

Lombard Street is known for the one-way block on Russian Hill between Hyde and Leavenworth Streets, where eight sharp turns are said to make it the most crooked street in the world. The design, first suggested by property owner Carl Henry[4] and built in 1922,[5] was intended to reduce the hill‚Äôs natural 27 percent grade,[6] which was too steep for most vehicles. The crooked block is about 600 feet (180 m) long (412.5 feet (125.7 m) straightline), is one-way (downhill) and is paved with red bricks. The sign at the top recommends 5 mph (8 km/h).

I‚Äôm sure that those of you who have read Initial D will be thinking of
In Initial D Third Stage
Takumi vs. Kobayashi, Toyota AE86 vs. MR-2
The 55th minute and 55th second approach to the corner

Too bad it‚Äôs just an anime.

In the real world, they‚Äôre wimps.
I didn‚Äôt have a driver‚Äôs license yet, and my partner didn‚Äôt have confidence in his curves.
So they ended up parking on the side of the road and hailing an Uber to Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf.
And specifically instructed the driver to cross from Nine Quarters Flower Street.

The driver was understanding and slowed down for the curve

The sun is shining, the greenery is dripping, the flowers are clustered, and the flowers are beautiful.

BTW, remember to wear sunglasses. üï∂Ô∏è

Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf & Alcatraz Island

San Francisco‚Äôs Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf gets its name and neighborhood characteristics from the city‚Äôs early days of the mid to later 1800s when Italian immigrant fishermen came to the city to take advantage of the influx of population due to the gold rush. Most of the Italian immigrant fishermen settled in the North Beach area close to the wharf and fished for the local delicacies and dungeness crab. From then until the present day the wharf remained the center of operations for San Francisco‚Äôs fishing fleet. Despite its redevelopment into a tourist attraction during the 1970s and 1980s, the area is still home to many active fishermen and their fleets.

There‚Äôs a big crab in the square. ü¶ÄÔ∏è

The grocery store next door is filled with all kinds of Made in China gadgets.

Alcatraz. üòà

Visitors can reach the island in a little under 15 minutes by ferry ride from Pier 33, located between the San Francisco Ferry Building and Fisherman‚Äôs Wharf, San Francisco

There‚Äôs a World War II hero, a decommissioned warship and a submarine next to the pier.

There‚Äôs some people playing music in the square. üéµ
I was very impressed that there was a grandfather there very intently playing a very happy tune, as if there were no pedestrians around
Is this the heart flow? The little mage exclaimed to the point of creating the urge to go and tip him
It‚Äôs also a long-standing regret.

God, it‚Äôs blue as poison.

Infinite Loop

I always thought the ship was an Infinite Loop.
As the name implies, it goes round and round in an infinite circle.
The goose is not.
It‚Äôs actually a park. There‚Äôs a Visitor Center.

I didn‚Äôt know this was the only place that had a souvenir t shirt.
Picked Metal‚Äôs sloppily.

As for Apple Park.
It‚Äôs still under construction‚Ä¶

Stanford

It came out in a circle.
I feel like I was brought here as a child.
Maybe I can get 50 more points on the SAT.

California State Route 1

The sea in the movie is so romantic, holding hands and walking slowly along the beach.
For the little mages who have been living in the inner continent
It‚Äôs always been a dream to find a girl and go see the sea.

I saw the Pacific Ocean before I saw the sea.
The Beaches of Goose California
The sand is very sticky.
If you‚Äôre not paying attention, the water will come up past your trouser legs.
The frightened little mage recoiled.
The sea breeze is salty and foul, and the beach is littered with kelp carcasses.
There was no epiphany at sea level.
It‚Äôs the sunlight that‚Äôs particularly harsh.
He and his buddy went back at night with varying degrees of sunburn.

Any exposed part of your body ‚Äî including your earlobes, scalp and lips ‚Äî can burn. Even covered areas can burn if, for example, your clothing has a loose weave that allows ultraviolet (UV) light through. Your eyes, which are extremely sensitive to the sun‚Äôs UV light, also can burn.

When a UV photon strikes the skin, it can damage the DNA in the body‚Äôs cells. It does this by breaking the orderly bonds between the four nucleotides, adenosine, thymine and guanine. So-called thymine dimers form, when two thymine nucleotides bind together, throwing the whole shape of the DNA molecule out of whack.
The cell with the messed-up DNA usually then commits suicide, a process called apoptosis. ‚ÄúThe cells receive so much radiation that they undergo apoptosis,‚Äù

Awkward üòÖ
Very poor experience
It‚Äôs not romantic‚Ä¶
It‚Äôs all lies in the movies.

Soylent & iRobot

Before that, the tycoon kept saying that the Xiaomi robot didn‚Äôt have enough suction power, so he had to buy the iRobot.
It‚Äôs a great deal, and just in time for Amazon‚Äôs 700 series sale, I got it for over $3,000.

But there was no 900 series with visual navigation back then.
It‚Äôs still a random collision algorithm, so if you‚Äôre at home, you‚Äôll think the robot is stupid.
But I usually come home from work and find the robot still at the charging station.
If the floor wasn‚Äôt clean, I‚Äôd think I was slacking off.
Also the quality is pretty good, knocked the humidifier over once when I wasn‚Äôt there.
I came home and found that I had sucked in a bellyful of water and thought it was broken, but it turned out to be fine.

Bottles of Soylent with free in-country shipping, I bought a case for breakfast in case I‚Äôm too lazy to get to the venue in the morning.

entry.title: üá∫üá∏-0-0
entry.content:
USA-0-0

Lucky draw

In ‚Äò15 Little Master had been writing Swift for over a year and was told to go to the WWDC session
The little mage was baffled, didn‚Äôt know what WWDC was, looked it up and clicked on a section
I was surprised to find out that even though I‚Äôm not good at English, I can make a plausible guess.
Thinking back to the days of Android tutorials, totally cloudy
So instantly filled with good feelings, went through most of the videos from that year, and benefited a lot!

Follow up to learn that with a developer account, Visa/MC credit card, you can draw a prize!
Register at the beginning of March each year at official website for one week only, so make sure you don‚Äôt miss out!

Due to the large number of people, Apple will randomly select some lucky (company reimbursement) or unlucky (self-pay) leeks to give 10,000 tickets!
After that, we‚Äôll deduct the money whether we go or not.
No matter if the US visa is denied, denied entry, etc., the money is non-refundable.
Tickets are also forbidden to be transferred, only to other developer accounts of the same company.
Anyway, if you win the lottery, you don‚Äôt get your money back, so think carefully about the draw.

But luck was never his turn for this kind of thing, so he signed up for the no-brainer

Bingo

The results of the lottery will be announced around the end of March.

I got a $1,599 chargeback text from China Merchants Bank in the middle of the night and a stolen lock card phone call.
Too busy proving to the bank that he is himself.
I woke up the next day at noon to a confirmation email.
Busy calling the little ones and being told to hurry up with visa and hotel preparations!

Apple is offering hotels near the venue, and the price of a goose is Apple, with the cheapest costing $229 a night.
Thinking that one person is still close by, I had to make an appointment.

Luckily, one of my colleagues said he didn‚Äôt get the lottery, but he wanted to go.
Plus he‚Äôs got two buddies from Canada üá®So_1F1E6 and So_1F1F8 from the middle of the United States who can fly to San Francisco for fun!

So checked out of the hotel and made a reservation with an Airbnb that looked pretty good.

And the little one will drive. We have a reservation for Herz.

It‚Äôs perfect.

Visa

First you have to have a passport.
Unlike the people who come up here and just get off the plane in a foreign country.
The little mage has never been anywhere before. A blank book.
Luckily, I got it when I went home to visit my parents in 15 years.

Then make a reservation at official website.
Pay online and make an appointment for an interview

Prove yourself to apply a little faster than Taobao agent!
The payment page redirects to CITIC Bank
At first glance, the page looks like a phishing site‚Ä¶

Interview

The imperial capital, the U.S. Embassy in Beijing, is in Sanyuanqiao, Chaoyang District.

Leave the afternoon of the interview.
When I got to the embassy, I was amazed. I‚Äôve only seen long lines like this at the Spring Festival.
The people waiting for their visas were twisting and turning, with 10,000 zigzagging queues of people waiting for their visas.
Crawling on my belly for 3 hours before I see the window for the visa.

A total of 5-6 Chinese interview windows and 1 quiet English window.

My friend suddenly said he knew English, so he went to the English window without waiting.
The little mage thought about it and decided to give it a try.

The interviewer was a grandmother, and I can‚Äôt remember exactly what was said, but it was something along the lines of.

‚Ä¶
Ô£ø invite us to join their conference

The old grandmother said in surprise:
Are you working for Apple?

(Little Mage thought: emmm, 2019 really, but unfortunately the current timeline is only 2016, so I had to say)
No, it‚Äôs a developer conference.

grandmotherÔºöWhy they invite you?
‚Ä¶

Open the folder to take out the Invitation Letter.
The grandmother pointed them to the Chinese window off to the side

The security lady who kept order next to them saw that they were kicked down and asked what happened.
Sighed at this situation, but thankfully didn‚Äôt just say no and let them wait next to her for a while

Then the Chinese interview was with a foreign girl.
She‚Äôs confused, too. Conference.
Guess people who are not in the IT world don‚Äôt know what the conference is.
So she took out the invitation, and the lady said she didn‚Äôt want to read it, and proceeded to ask him to explain why

The little mage was stunned, if it might have been because of the language before, why not read the material this time as well?
I‚Äôve only heard of people who have been rejected for not bringing documents, but I‚Äôve never heard of people who have documents that they don‚Äôt read.
Fortunately, the partner said it was a Developer Meeting, and the lady understood in a second (üòì‚Ä¶)

I‚Äôm not going to be able to do anything about it.

It was a long half-minute wait.
The little sister smiled and said congratulations, your visas are approved.
You‚Äôll get your passport in the mail in a few business days.

It‚Äôs a lot of twists and turns, and I‚Äôm not particularly happy about it.
I thanked him and went home with my partner.

Then the tycoon who used to live in Boston heard about the Chinese interview.
We can both meet together.
We can even bring the whole family together.
His jaw is dropping.

US visa
It‚Äôs fallen.
He said.

Air tickets

When the ticket was unaware that United was not well rated, the worshipful abandonment of the national airline
And that was before the infamous beating of Asians.

In fact, on any flight, 12 hours straight would have turned the little mage into a corpse!
United isn‚Äôt that strict about turning off cell phones. ‚úàÔ∏è Go. Little wizard took a picture of the horizon.

I never would have guessed that UA888, the flight number, would be encountered four years later in FANNG‚Äôs Assignment.

Entry

Getting off the plane, entering the country

Somehow I had a vision that there were snipers lurking behind customs.
If we find the suspect, we‚Äôll shoot him on sight.
Plus, it‚Äôs the first time I‚Äôve set foot in another country, so I‚Äôm still a little nervous.

Customs asks the usual questions, like why you‚Äôre here, how long you‚Äôre staying.
According to the visa, it didn‚Äôt say it was a conference, it said it was a Developer Meeting.
Then customs stamped it.

The little mage took back his passport and immediately appeared calm and relaxed, but in reality, he accelerated his pace to go inside
Fear of being shot.

After seeing some of the pickups, I remembered that my little friend hadn‚Äôt come out yet.
I waited half a day, thinking my partner was GG, and then I saw him.
So the conference was checked out for a while.

Conference is really toxic üòÇ

Downtown

Pick up your car from the airport, drop off your bags at Airbnb.

It‚Äôs still a long way to Downtown from San Francisco ‚úàÔ∏è.
I didn‚Äôt expect to arrive in 20 minutes, a distance that would take 10,000 years in the capital.

It‚Äôs exactly as Airbnb saw it, no fraud!
Except that the House is two stories, like a wood-paneled structure, with another tenant upstairs, which makes a lot of noise when running.
There‚Äôs a garden in the back. Very nice.

Yosemite

Selected as a World Heritage Site in 1984, Yosemite is internationally recognized for its spectacular granite cliffs, waterfalls, crystal-clear streams, giant redwood forests and biodiversity.

On the way out to Yosemite, about 3 hours by car, I saw a bunch of big windmills.
Turning the corner, I suddenly saw the OS X Yosemite wallpaper.
All I‚Äôve seen in China before are dirt mountains, but this is the first time I‚Äôve seen this kind of bare, steep granite.
So much so that it‚Äôs a mistake to think that foreign mountains are harder than Chinese ones.

It‚Äôs incredible.

The little mage was staring at the sunset on the way back.

entry.title: The side effect of Polyphasic sleep
entry.content:
I tried Polyphasic sleep when the first time I heard about it. It‚Äôs almost 2 years after that time.

It‚Äôs not a rigorous Polyphasic sleep, for I‚Äôm using 6 hour major sleep episode and three 30-minute power naps. And I use hypnosis when I have naps at the same time.

It‚Äôs really good. Usually I‚Äôll wake up at 6 in the morning and do tons of work, then I feel tired and have the first nap at 10 or 11 and wake up with many Chinese people. I‚Äôll have the second nap after lunch, the third when I went home.

This hack method gives me an illusion that daytime is stretched, because every time I wake up from a nap, I feel it‚Äôs totally a new day.

But I found a side effect recently, which is the malaise was also magnified. Especially I‚Äôm in anxiety these days.

It‚Äôs not polyphasic sleep‚Äôs fault, I think, time to read Burns David‚Äôs When Panic Attacks.

entry.title: Segmentation fault: 11
entry.content:
• Mac OS X 10.11.4
  • Xcode 7.3
  • Swift 2.2

error: cannot convert value of type '[(String, Int)]' to expected argument type '[(name: String, age: Int)]?'

So, I renamed the tuple list type to [(name: String, age: Int)]

Everything is fine? right?

But when I Archived the project in Fastest, Aggressive Optimizations [-Ofast] and Fast, Whole Module Optimization [-O -whole-module-optimization]

Command failed due to signal: Segmentation fault: 11

The error message is irrelevant and helpless

I checked out commit by commit, and finally found that it was the name of tuple cause the error.

entry.title: Observer
entry.content:
It seems my observer come back.

I began to know the mental models when I was finished be friendly with the time, It took me one month to read that pure thin book.

When I was glad that my mental models improved, The Power of Now: A Guide to Spiritual Enlightenment announced that mind is a trap, the forecast ability of mind focus on the future, it prevent you to know the power of present. These different arguments confused me at that time. As I continues to read, the concept of observer appeared in my eyes.

For the first time I heard about observer was in my college. I read that word from The dark forest. It‚Äôs more fascinating after I read one book about quantum mechanics.

There is also an idea about observer in psychology. It is not only different from the idea above(Observer (quantum physics)) but also Design Patterns(Observer pattern). When I finished Think on These Things one year later, I try to build an observer about myself.
Because usually things will be more clear when you saw others doing it. The weakness and blind spot is apparent and evident, you will find better solution.

It is glad that I achieved this goal in my gap year, there was two versions of me, one acting, one watching.
I do not think the observer equals to superego, but it is clearly a guardian of ego.

But when I worked to Beijing one year and a half ago, all the works I builded ruined. The observer of me was gone. I had some new bed habits like watch the watch frequently which reveal my anxious and nervous.

When I do something wrong, I felt exhausted. Luckily I had a long vacation that I went to my parent‚Äôs home. Although that town is not an outfield, but at least it detach me from the supercity. Also, I have some deep talks about my dreams with my parents. They feels helpless because our poor family and the rising hotel rates, and they cannot understand why I‚Äôm acting so odd.

After 10 days later my vacation due, I felt relief.

entry.title: Chrome to Safari
entry.content:
I use Chrome from the very beginning. I was impressed by it is simplicity and variety. Even I upgrade my laptop to Macbook, I‚Äôm still using it because of three main reasons

  • Plugin
  • Shortcut
  • Develop
  • Flash

But after my TL amway me, I tried Safari deeply, and found:

Plugin

  • Adblock Plus
  • 1Password
  • Evernote
  • AutoPagerize
  • Clean Links for Google

Shortcut

I can use opt+cmd+> on Chrome to change tabs, it is shift+cmd+[ on Safari
shift+cmd+z to unclose the most recent closed tabs, it‚Äôs no corresponding key on Safari, I can only use history instead.

Develop

I used to opt+cmd+i in chrome to simulate iPhone, I can compare iOS version with front end in this way.
When I got to know what‚Äôs safari‚Äôs Develop look like, (cmd+, -> Advanced -> Show Develop menu in menu bar or opt+cmd+r) I surrendered.

Flash

Finally, I accept that different device have their own place. So as for most Chinese video Website still using flash, I chose chrome to watch them.

entry.title: iOS App Submission Nightmare
entry.content:
iOS App Submission Nightmare

bluetooth-peripheral

  1. the bluetooth correlative code no longer be used after redesgin app, you should del both code and:
  2. Targets -> Capabilities -> bluetooth

com.apple.security.application-groups

  1. close app group
  2. del *.entitlements
  3. grep -R --include="*.*" ".entitlements" . you‚Äôll find hidden entitlements in Xcode -> imeican -> build setting

ITMS-90394 Missing Icon

  • We have *29x29@3x.png in Xcode
  • In fact the .png is a .svg
  • new a real *29x29@3x.png

ITMS-90205 90206

Embed Frameworks Archive del carthage copy-frameworks

.bcsymbolmap'> as expected

  • Enable Bitcode

ITMS-90087 90209 x84_64 i386

  • Targets(Embed Frameworks) -> Run Script

entry.title: How to detect 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz Best Channel on Mac OS X
entry.content:
My Zeppelin Air disconnect to my router from time to time

The main reason seems that my 2.4GHz channel in which has to much Noise with other people‚Äôs

If you use Mac, you can

alt + wifi icon -> Open Wireless Diagnostics

Menu -> Window -> Scan -> Scan Now

your will see a window like this:

Summary
‚Ä¶‚Ä¶
Best 2.4 GHz1, 2
Best 5 GHz36, 40

enjoy the music ~

entry.title: When a company become bigger
entry.content:
Do the right thing much more importent than doing things right. the former phrase means you have your own argument and reason. The right measures your own justice and can you responsible for your own actions. But when you joined to a big company, your manager concerned is that can you doing things right. That is why startup companies have more energy.

Humans are by nature social animals, if a group has less than 140 people, it can managed by itself. Because everyone knows what others doing, they can easily have a common points of view about someone, there is no place for cribbers. But when the group become bigger, fog and shadow are appear, your ability and capability largely depend on your manager, it‚Äôs no longer based on your real contributions.

Most companies have hundreds of employees, that‚Äôs why office politics so common in big companies. How to dealing with office politics is in primary. After all, it related to your salary and promotion. If you want that, the best way is to become a politician, everyone knows what‚Äôs going on, but no one point out, just like The Emperor‚Äôs New Clothes. the risk is you may lose yourself.

That‚Äôs why an excellent startup company so attracting, but there always will be one day, the company become big as for it‚Äôs excellent. More and more strangers are joined, not everyone are friendly. if you still be yourself, and careless about politics, that may cause inappropriate, gossip will be everywhere, and when the new year come, you have no promotion without rhyme or reason.

The neutral way was working like an android, don‚Äôt share any of your emotions and feelings, that will makes your colleagues feels some kind of professional. The disadvantage is that there is no chance you will be consider as a friend. but as for the company already changed ( not a startup any more ), it‚Äôs more acceptable than the previous one.

entry.title: Harvard Positive Psychology
entry.content:
I have watched this course in my gap year, and captured many screenshots. This course helps me a lot. For I clear up my old pictures today incidentally, It‚Äôs time to turn them to text.

Psychological maturity is about the ability to willingly shift perspective.

Goal

The step on the way to a destination that you deem valuable that is important to you.

So end goal can often be liberating.

One of the reasons is because love, and especially lust and passion wears over time.

They are also extremely sensitive, wise, way beyond their years, saintly, generous, benevolent

Exercise

The wonder drug: 30 minutes of physical exercise, 4 times a week.
At least 15 minutes of mindful exercise 6 or 7 times a week.

I have so many things to do.

Exercise should be the last thing to go. It is an investment.

You may lose that 45 minutes. But you‚Äôll gain so much more. It‚Äôs such a good investment. Your memory actually gets better when you exercise. So you‚Äôll get more buck for the bank in terms of time you study; your creativity and concentration levels go up

Whether you have ADD or not, especially if you have.

Relationship

People stay together out of a sense of duty, out of habit, because they think this is their lot in life.

A lack of alternative

‚Äúdo unto others what you would unto yourself.‚Äù

‚Äúdo not do unto yourself what you would not do unto others.‚Äù

Love

‚ÄúPerfect love is rare indeed - for to be a lover will require that you continually have the subtlety of the very wise, the flexibility of the child, the sensitivity of the artist, the understanding of the philosopher, the acceptance of the saint, the tolerance of the scholar and the fortitude of the certain.‚Äù

But while perfect love doesn‚Äôt exist, true love dose. True love exists between imperfect humans.

I will find that right person. I don‚Äôt believe that. It‚Äôs simply not true. It‚Äôs not the matter of faith.

So what makes relationship unique? It‚Äôs not finding that one right person. Once again it‚Äôs cultivating that one chosen relationship. It‚Äôs by virtue of working together, of being together, of spending time together, of dedicating one another. That‚Äôs how we create the one chosen relationship. That‚Äôs how we create the one chosen relationship.

entry.title: However, no eggs
entry.content:
I got the score last night and was shocked.

For these days I always check my score, but as it‚Äôs mid-autumn festival and National Day, they didn‚Äôt publish the score.

Three months ago, I had planned to take the exam again for the third time if I do not pass the last one. I only got a 5 on the first one, But I just wanted to gauge my real level in English. the score was totally acceptable. But for this time, even though I didn‚Äôt prepare either, I do a lot about the speaking part because I had one hour class with a foreign teacher everyday. And the last time, I didn‚Äôt even finished the second part, and for this time, I talked a lot with the examiner and made him laughed, so I think it will be at least 5+. But as the result, it‚Äôs still be 4.5.

For the reading and listening part, I increased them 0.5 for each, as I don‚Äôt have time to finish the second paragraph last time, it‚Äôs reasonable. But for the writing part, it‚Äôs decreased 0.5, so the total score was still 5.0.

It was hard for me to accepted this fact, because it not only means that my hard work was wasted but it also indicated where my actual limit is.

It made my sick for several hours, should I insist or re-plan?

According to TaiJi, I should reorder my schedule and base it on the fact, not illusion.

After all, I have to achieve goals step by step as a Diaosi.

But, I still need a little bit of time to heal this sorrow.

PS: the title means ‚ÄúÁÑ∂Âπ∂Âçµ‚Äù in Chinese.

entry.title: Summer Ends
entry.content:
Summer Ends
It‚Äôs a nice music, for summer really ends.

I wrote less, read less and felt bad in this year, before this, I‚Äôm in my gap year, and was productive and efficient, mind flow came up . So, I began to wonder why and try to return.

For I went to the gopher China in April, and meet with one IT crop. CTO, and talk to him that maybe I‚Äôm in a bottleneck period.

But it‚Äôs September now, the summer ends, I‚Äôve been in Beijing for a most one year, and still trapping in this mass state.

I tried to figure out

The model

First, the style of living (surviving in deed) was not like Hangzhou, when I was in Hangzhou, I can rent a flat which company was nearby that I can walk to work, and I have my own bathroom in my room so one bother me. But in Beijing, if I still use the same model, I have to live in an old flat, which the building was even old than me! even worse, I have to live with neighbors, share the bathroom kitchen and all other things. So you have to pray for your neighbors are good.
For me, as an internal person, I just want to live alone.

Once I resize this cause, I rent a new flat immediately and I‚Äôll move in the end of this month, but one year past and never came back.

English

I read at least 10 books each month before, but for I narrowed to English edition recent months, the numbers dropped so fiercely that I hardly finished a book in one month.

No books makes me feel sick, and no input, no output. That‚Äôs an important reason that I stopped posting blog and The little master series. Needless to say I forced myself all new blogs have to write in English.

Procrastination

It seems a universal problem. But after I read too much GTDs and found the healthy circle based on polyphasic sleep. I can do 16+ pomodoroes one day.
After I return to work in company, I just do what I want do, and I thought I was still efficient.

Even though I already outsource apply instead DIY, preparing IELTS and working hard still a big challenge to me, not only because I unknown the starting date but also my co-workers ungelivable. I have to write almost 70% codes in the main project and even to rewrote some functions off his part. I want to figure out one way to manage our new team( for right now I like a TL assistant)

So, all the apps that I used were return, and I feels it really improve my situation.

Slack

It‚Äôs not that Slack, although I have to write some code according to it‚Äôs API in future for our CI.

I found something I runaround but I have to face it again in future with more effort. like hope my co-workers write more, read the translate version books, excise, etc.

So, I dared not hope anymore.

That‚Äôs all, winter is coming.

entry.title: Little tips about rewrite an iOS app
entry.content:
I finished my Gap year and went to my current company last autumn.

I did‚Äôt do much as a new comer for the first month, and there was a software engineer from AMAP with 10 years experience. Everytime I had something to ask him, he explained it in the deepest level, and inspired me by rhetorical questions patiently. But at the same time, I found thousands and thousands Copy & Paste lines of code in the project. Yes, I counted it by using CLOC, and found that it‚Äôs almost 20 thousands lines in total.

As Objective-C is a excessively long and prolix programming language( which means that your have to write dozens of code to implement the same function which may only a line in Ruby üò´ ), it‚Äôs rational for the count of this project. But Copy & Paste should always avoided, worse I saw global variables and magic numbers are everywhere.üò∞

It‚Äôs odd, isn‚Äôt it? If a 10 years experienced programer who can deal with pointer easily and knows computer systems deeply, why didn‚Äôt he pay any attention to the code styles. After all, we need to prepare for adding new members in the team and new features at any time.

He said that most of code was written by him, it‚Äôs quick to fix bugs. However, he went to a start company of his friend in next month. So he just left, and also, the anfractuosity code.üò≠üò≠üò≠

to be continued‚Ä¶

entry.title: Xcode 6.x cannot run on EI Capitan
entry.content:
I watched WWDC and updated OS X to EI Capitan(10.11).
Everything seemed fine until I opened Xcode:

You can‚Äôt use this version of the application ‚ÄúXcode‚Äù with this version of OS X.
You have ‚ÄúXcode‚Äù 6.x.

Swift 2.0 is awesome, but according to Apple, if you want to submit an app which written by 2.0 to App Store, you need to wait until September.

Fortunately I found a hack command:

Which means you run Xcode from /dev/null and redirect output & error output to /dev/null in background.

Everything perfect in past several weeks.

entry.title: How to update homebrew daily
entry.content:
How to update homebrew daily

Example

The $Path must be your files full path

It‚Äôs weird that launchctl start didn‚Äôt work, so I had to added

It will run immediately after the plist be loaded.

CreatingLaunchdJobs
Apple‚Äôs document is so specific, so I just wrote some mistakes that I made

Be careful of the Lable

first I thought that this was unique, so I changed it

but when I loaded launchctl load launchd.plist after I finished the plist, it yeild:

launchd.plist: Invalid or missing service identifier

hence the <key> can not changed

Owner

It‚Äôs puzzled brew update if the user of the runner shell was system instead of ME. So I tested by users, luckily, It was ME

But if you want to log your logs, it‚Äôs better to written in your personal document, after all, the owner of the /var/log/ is root wheel, you‚Äôll get the Permission denied

zsh

Just write down #!/usr/local/bin/zsh (you can get yours by which zsh) at the beginning of the *.sh

chmod a+x $launchd.sh

Finally don‚Äôt forget x

entry.title: Homebrew cannot run C compiled programs
entry.content:
I can‚Äôt resist the temptation to upgrade my Mac to 10.11, but several tragedies happened, such as:

  • Proxifier - could not initialize Proxifier kext ( I already sent an email to the author, and replied that they are working to find a real reason of this error.)
  • istat menus - I never see it again, but can‚Äôt watching the network traffic which seems not a big deal
  • cleanmymac - I download the newest version as it guided and sadly found that they are the same version

but brew - configure: error: cannot run C compiled programs.

so, brew doctor , it shows:

Warning: You are using OS X 10.11.
We do not provide support for this pre-release version.
You may encounter build failures or other breakage.

Warning: Your Xcode (6.3.2) is outdated
Please update to Xcode 7.0.
Xcode can be updated from the App Store.

Then setup my Xcode-beta as the system default Xcode

:)

entry.title: Xcode plugins faild to be loaded after updated
entry.content:
You can type the command in terminal after Xcode updated

this will added your new Xcode UUID to DVTPlugInCompatibilityUUID

But that is a risky way, for instance my Xcode 6.3.2 always crash after I ran this command without brain.

So I had to open the folder ~/Library/Application Support/Developer/Shared/Xcode/Plug-ins and deleted some suspicious plugins.

Of course also you can check the tail -f /var/log/system.log, and found which plugin cause the Xcode crash exactly in ~/Library/Logs/DiagnosticReports/Xcode_$time_$macbookname.crash

FinallyÔºåwith my best wishes :)

entry.title: What I talk about when I talk about running
entry.content:
‰π¶‰∏≠ÈáçÂ§¥Ëá≥Â∞æÂº•Êº´Ëøô‰∏ÄÁßçËãçËÄÅÁöÑÊ∞îÊÅØ
ÂØπ‰∫éÊó∂Èó¥ÁöÑÊµÅÈÄùÔºåËÇâ‰ΩìËÉΩÂäõÁöÑ‰∏ãÈôçÔºåÂç¥ÂèàÊó†ÂèØÂ•à‰Ωï

‰∏éË¥∏ÁÑ∂ÊäµÊäóÔºåÂùöÊåÅ‰∏çÊúçËÄÅ‰∏çÂêåÊòØÁöÑÔºå‰ΩúËÄÖÈÄêÊ∏êÊé•ÂèóËøô‰∏™‰∫ãÂÆûÔºåÂπ∂‰ª•Ê≠§‰∏∫ËßÑÂàôÂ∫îÂØπ

ÂæàÂ§öÊàëÂ•ΩÂ•áÁöÑÈóÆÈ¢òÔºå‰ΩúËÄÖ‰πüÂèçÊÄùËøáÂπ∂‰∏îÊõ¥Âä†Ê∑±ÂÖ•

ËøôÂ§ßÊ¶ÇÂ∞±ÊòØÔºö

I‚Äôm the kind of person who likes to be by himself.

I stop every day right at the point where I feel I can write more. Do that, and the next day‚Äôs work goes surprisingly smoothly. I think Ernest Hemingway did something like that. To keep on going, you have to keep up the rhythm. This is the important thing for longCterm projects.

I‚Äôm the type of person who doesn‚Äôt find it painful to be alone. I find spending an hour or two every day running alone, not speaking to anyone, as well as four or five hours alone at my desk, to be neither difficult nor boring.

I ran a bar, so I learned the importance of being with others and the obvious point that we can‚Äôt survive on our own.

The clouds are mere guests in the sky that pass away and vanish, leaving behind the sky.

it‚Äôs precisely because people are different from others that they‚Äôre able to create their own independent selves.

I had to give it everything I had. If I failed, I could accept that. But I knew that if I did things halfheartedly and they didn‚Äôt work out, I‚Äôd always have regrets.

I only began to enjoy studying after I got through the educational system and became a soCcalled member of society.

We‚Äôd closed the club, so we also decided that from now on we‚Äôd meet with only the people we wanted to see and, as much as possible, get by not seeing those we didn‚Äôt. We felt that, for a time at least, we could allow ourselves this modest indulgence.

It was my real schooling. But you can‚Äôt keep up that kind of life forever. Just as with school, you enter it, learn something, and then it‚Äôs time to leave.

I‚Äôm struck by how, except when you‚Äôre young, you really need to prioritize in life, figuring out in what order you should divide up your time and energy. If you don‚Äôt get that sort of system set by a certain age, you‚Äôll lack focus and your life will be out of balance

In other words, you can‚Äôt please everybody

Life just isn‚Äôt fair, is how it used to strike me. Some people can work their butts off and never get what they‚Äôre aiming for, while others can get it without any effort at all.

It suits me. Or at least because I don‚Äôt find it all that painful.

The most important thing we ever learn at school is the fact that the most important things can‚Äôt be learned at school

while they‚Äôre getting by on these, they may actually discover real, hidden talent within them

I‚Äôve always done whatever I felt like doing in life. People may try to stop me, and convince me I‚Äôm wrong, but I won‚Äôt change.

My own individual, stubborn, uncooperative, often selfCcentered nature that still doubts itself‚Äîthat, when troubles occur, tries to find something funny, or something nearly funny, about the situation.

This takes time, of course, but sometimes taking time is actually a shortcut.

entry.title: Pull to Refresh UIViewController in iOS
entry.content:
If you force to add a UIRefreshControl to a UIViewController, you will get an error:
UIRefreshControl may only be managed by a UITableViewController

So, here is the trick

Code

1 init a tableView in your UIViewController

2 add refreshControl to tableView, not view

3 refreshView function

If you like to use Storyboard like me

  1. Storyboard -> UITableViewController -> enable Refreshing
  2. Then you can Ctrl drag just like UIButton

entry.title: xmlParseEntityRef no name AND Input is not proper UTF-8
entry.content:
I found that the RSS of my blog was dead a few days ago.

First, I thought it‚Äôs a bug of the theme, so I updated the theme today, but the problem was still there.

It yelled:

I Googled and found that it was a silly problem just because I felt that it‚Äôs cool using & rather than and.
The truth is that & will conflict with HTML tags and it costed me 1 hour.

But after that, The RSS was still not resurrection.

It said something in the graveyard.

It seems some odd characters exist in that article.

After check the syntax of RSS feeds of my blog on Feed Validation Service

It shows this:

Coping the text to Sublime

What a surprise‚Ä¶

Êàë‰ª¨Â∫îËØ•ÂÉèÂØπÂæÖËá™ÁÑ∂ÈÇ£Ê†∑ÂØπÂæÖÊäÄÊúØÂÖÉÁ¥†„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨‰∏çËÉΩË¶ÅÊ±ÇÁßëÊäÄÊúç‰ªéÊàë‰ª¨ÔºåÂ∞±ÂÉè‰∏çËÉΩË¶ÅÊ±ÇÁîüÂëΩÊúç‰ªéÊàë‰ª¨„ÄÇÊúâÊó∂Êàë‰ª¨Â∫îËØ•Ëá£Êúç‰∫éÂÆÉÁöÑÊåáÂºïÔºå‰πê‰∫éÊÑüÂèóÂÆÉÁöÑÂ§öÂßøÂ§öÂΩ©ÔºõÊúâÊó∂Êàë‰ª¨Â∫îËØ•Âä™ÂäõÊîπÈÄ†ÂÆÉÁöÑÊú¨Êù•Èù¢ÁõÆÔºå‰ª•ËøéÂêàËá™Â∑±ÁöÑÈúÄÊ±Ç„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨‰∏çÂøÖÊâßË°åÊäÄÊúØÂÖÉÁ¥†ÁöÑÊâÄÊúâË¶ÅÊ±ÇÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÊàë‰ª¨ËÉΩÂ§üÂ≠¶‰ºöÂà©Áî®ËøôËÇ°ÂäõÈáèÔºåËÄå‰∏çÊòØ‰∏é‰πãÂØπÊäó

ËØ≠Ë®ÄÊòØÊäÄÂ∑ßÔºåËÆ©ÊÄùÁª¥ËÉΩÂ§üËá™ÊàëË¥®ÁñëÔºõÊòØÈ≠îÈïúÔºåÂëäËØâÂ§ßËÑëËá™Â∑±Âú®ÊÉ≥‰ªÄ‰πàÔºõÊòØÊéßÂà∂ÊùÜÔºåÂ∞ÜÊÄùÊÉ≥ËΩ¨Âåñ‰∏∫Â∑•ÂÖ∑„ÄÇËØ≠Ë®ÄÊéåÊè°‰∫ÜËá™ÊàëÊÑèËØÜÂíåËá™ÊàëÂØπÁÖßÁöÑÊçâÊë∏‰∏çÂÆöÁöÑÊó†ÁõÆÊ†áËøêÂä®Ôºå‰ªéËÄåËÉΩÂ§üÈ©æÈ©≠ÊÄùÁª¥Ôºå‰Ωø‰πãÊàê‰∏∫Êñ∞ÊÄùÊÉ≥ÁöÑÊ∫êÊ≥â„ÄÇÊ≤°ÊúâËØ≠Ë®ÄÁöÑÁêÜÊÄßÊû∂ÊûÑÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Êó†Ê≥ïËé∑Áü•Ëá™Â∑±ÁöÑÁ≤æÁ•ûÊ¥ªÂä®ÔºåËá™ÁÑ∂Â∞±‰∏çËÉΩÊÄùËÄÉÊàë‰ª¨ÁöÑË°å‰∏∫ÊñπÂºè„ÄÇ

entry.title: Count Lines of Code
entry.content:
When I was reading iOS 7 Programming Cookbook, it occurred to me that how many lines of Obj-c codes exactly I have written.

I used to use SourceCounter to do this earlier when I was still in Windows OS.

But SourceCounter do not support Mac OS X.

So, I found and interesting commond line:

‚Äú^$‚Äú means blank line
‚Äúwc -l‚Äù means WordCount line

I still recommend another tool which is written by Perl:

CLOC - Count Lines of Code

Install:

Use

Here is result of my codes

entry.title: iOS Programming - Big Nerd Ranch Guides
entry.content:
1 day = 15 PomoToDo = 90 pages
So, I not only passed this book just in one week, but also wrote all the code in the samples to Xcode.

But I still feel a little bit of slower in this progress, considering my programming language skills, especially learning Go in a few weeks.

I think the biggest obstacle isn‚Äôt Objective-C but iOS‚Äôs framework.

By the way, if I learn MFC or Android in school with heart, this may be faster and easier for me now.

And another big thing is the Nature Language or just English. Because the latest documents of iOS dev are all written in English‚Ä¶

As you know, iOS 7 & Obj-C were something old after iOS 8 and Swift were coming at the same time in this WWDC. But a lot of books of Chinese version are still using xib or even MRC‚Ä¶ And most of all, English is not my mother tongue.

All in all, Cookbook should be read in the next step.

entry.title: global gitignore
entry.content:
xxx.xcodeproj/project.xcworkspace/xcuserdata/xxx.xcuserdatad/UserInterfaceState.xcuserstate

I was annoyed by this file.

It seems xCode update this file almost every second.
So, everytime I wanted to merge two heads, I would get a yellow conflict notification with this advantage function‚Ä¶

All in all, I forgot to set a global gitignore files.

This file is in your home directory, which means ~/.gitignore.

And, I found a very good website

http://www.gitignore.io/

According to your Operating System, IDE, or Programming Language, it can generate a ignore list.

Here is Xcode‚Äôs:

Do you see that *.xcuserstate above?

And your can also install it on your system by command line.

Then, you can list it by gi xcode or append it by gi xcode >> ~/.gitignore

entry.title: The Entrepreneur's Credo
entry.content:
ÁæéÂõΩ‰ºÅ‰∏öÂÆ∂‰πã‰ø°Êù°

ÁúãËµ∑Êù•ÂæàÈ∏°ÂÜªÔºåÂ§ßËá¥ÊÑèËØë‰∫Ü‰∏ãÔºåË°®Â§™ËæÉÁúü
ÂÅöÂÆå‰∫ÜÊâçÂèëÁé∞ËøôÂ∞±ÊòØËã±ÊñáÁâàÁöÑ„ÄäÊúâÊ¢¶ÊÉ≥Â∞±ÊúâÂ∏åÊúõ„Äã‰∏´

I do not choose to be a common man,

Êàë‰πÉË¢´ÈÄâÂè¨‰πã‰∫∫ÔºåÊ≥®ÂÆöÁîüÈùûÂ∏∏‰∫∫

It is my right to be uncommon ‚Ä¶ if I can,

Â¶ÇÊûúÊàëÊÑøÊÑèÔºåÊúâÊùÉÁâπÁ´ãÁã¨Ë°å

I seek opportunity ‚Ä¶ not security.

ÊàëÂØªÊ±ÇÊú∫ÈÅáÔºåËÄåÈùûÂÆâÂÖ®ÊÑü

I do not wish to be a kept citizen, Humbled and dulled by having the State look after me.

Êàë‰∏çÊÉ≥Êàê‰∏∫Â∞èÂ∏ÇÊ∞ëÔºåÂçëË¥±Âπ∂È∫ªÊú®ÁöÑË¢´ËÅîÈÇ¶ÂúàÂÖª

I want to take the calculated risk, to dream and to build, to fail and to succeed.

ÊàëÊúüÊúõÂÜíÂèØÊéßÁöÑÈ£éÈô©ÔºåÁªèÊ¢¶ÊÉ≥Âà∞ÂÆûÁé∞ÔºåÁî±Â§±Ë¥•Âà∞ÊàêÂäü

I refuse to barter incentive for a dole;

ÊàëÊãíÁªùÈ¢ÜÊïëÊµéÈáëÁöÑËØ±ÊÉë

I prefer the challenges of life to the guaranteed existence;

Áõ∏ÂØπ‰∫éÊúâ‰øùÈöúÁöÑÂ≠òÂú®ÔºåÊàëÈÄâÊã©Áª≥ÂëΩ‰∏≠ÁöÑÊåëÊàò

the thrill of fulfillment to the stale calm of Utopia.

Áõ∏ÂØπ‰∫é‰πåÊâòÈÇ¶ÂºèÁöÑÂÆÅÈùôÔºåÊàëÈÄâÊã©Âü∫ÊÉÖÊøÄÊÉÖÁöÑÂÆûË∑µ

I will not trade my freedom for beneficence nor my dignity for a handout.

Êàë‰∏ç‰ºöÊãø Ëá™Áî±Âéª‰∫§Êç¢ÊÅ©ÊÉ†ÔºåÊãøÂ∞ä‰∏•Âéª‰πûÊ±ÇÊïëÊµé

I will never cower before any master nor bend to any threat.

ÊàëÁªù‰∏ç‰ºöÂú®ÊùÉÂ®ÅÂâçÁïèÁº©ÔºåÂú®ÊÅêÂêìÂâçÂ±àÊúç

It is my heritage to stand erect, proud, and unafraid;

È°∂Â§©Á´ãÂú∞„ÄÅËá™Ë±™„ÄÅÊó†ÊâÄÁïèÊÉß ÊòØÊàëÁöÑ‰º†Áªü

to think and act for myself;

‰Ωú‰∏∫Ëá™ÊàëÂéªÊÄùËÄÉÂπ∂Ë°åÂä®

to enjoy the benefit of my creations;

Âéª‰∫´ÂèóÊàëÊâÄÂàõÈÄ†‰πãÁâ©ÁöÑÁõäÂ§Ñ

and to face the world boldly and say:

ÂãáÊï¢ÁöÑÈù¢ÂØπ‰∏ñÁïåÂπ∂ÂÆ£Áß∞Ôºö

‚ÄúThis, with God‚Äôs help, I have done.‚Äù

Áªº‰∏äÊâÄËØâÔºåÊúâ‰∫ÜÁ•ûÁöÑÂ∏ÆÂä©ÔºàÂìáÈù†ÔºåÈáçÁÇπÁªà‰∫éÂá∫Áé∞‰∫ÜÔºâÔºåÊàëÁªà‰∫éÊêûÂÆö‰∫ÜÔºàPS: Â¶ÇÊûúÊ≤°‰∏äÈù¢ÈÇ£Âè•ÔºåÊòØÂê¶Â∫îËØ•ËØëÊàê‚ÄúÊàëÂ∑≤ÁªèÂÆåËõã‰∫Ü‚Äù ‚Üí_‚ÜíÔºâ„ÄÇ

‚ÄîEntrepreneur‚Äôs Credo of the American

‚Äî‚ÄîÁæéÂõΩ‰ºÅ‰∏öÂÆ∂‰πã‰ø°Êù°

ÈÇ£‰∏™‰∫∫Ëâ∞‰∏çÊãÜÁöÑÈáçÁÇπÂêéÔºåËÆ©ÊàëÊÉ≥Ëµ∑‰∫Ü‰∏ÄÁØáÁ•ûË¥¥Ôºö

„ÄäÊúâÊ¢¶ÊÉ≥Â∞±ÊúâÂ∏åÊúõ„Äã

entry.title: How to install reaver on Mac OS X
entry.content:
updated: 2017-05-24 09:03:10

Sorry about this post, I did not realise how dangerous it is earlier.

Last October my net was overdue, I reaver a wifi for a tmp use for the new net needed national day holiday past.

I found my TV (android system) had a subtitle which said ‚ÄúThis net is only for my personal use, is that you have some problem?‚Äù when I played the Open Yale Courses - Listening to Music on my NAS.

I was shock by this, my NAS has a PandoraBox System, I use it as a bridging, usually my TV should not a appear on their router. It is clearly this wifi which I reavered is a phishing wifi, and my TV was hacked.

So, if some stupid apps were still using http, all my data was exposed. Even https have a MitM problem. Ô£ø‚Äôs products say iOS, macOS have a login trusted Certificates in Keychain, but what for Android? Some devices have they own back doors.

As for my TV, I think it used adb connect <TV IP address> which is Android Debug Bridge (adb) Wireless Debugging Over Wi-Fi.

However, I changed most password laterly.

So, you can try reaver for tech explore, but nerve use it.

updated: 2015-07-27 13:14:32

I wrote this in 2014-05-11, however after one year late, you can easily install reaver by using Homebrew right now.

Thanks for Rustam‚Äôs tips

I always use beini in vmware, and plug an extra usb wireless adapter to my PC every time.

When I have my Mac, I just copy beini‚Äôs VMX from Windows to Mac, which means I still have to use the wireless adapter.

In fact, minidwep or inflator are using Reaver as a powerful tool to ‚Ä¶ (You know it), and Mac is a unix based system, which can run Reaver directly.

  1. Download: reaver-osx.zip
    ( tips: the original reaver-1.4 can‚Äôt direct make on Mac )
  2. unzip reaver-osx.zip

Enjoin it & Don‚Äôt be evil :-)

entry.title: Polyphasic Sleep
entry.content:
ËææËä¨Â•áÁù°Áú†

Powerful Sleep ‰∏≠ËØ¥Ëøá

ÂÆûÈôÖÊÉÖÂÜµÊòØ‰ªñ‰ª¨Â∑≤ÁªèÁù°ÁöÑÂ§™Â§ö‰∫ÜÔºåËÄå‰∏îÁ≤æÁ•ûÁä∂ÊÄÅÂíåÁù°Áú†Ë¥®Èáè‰∏ÄÊ†∑Â∑Æ„ÄÇ‰πãÊâÄ‰ª•Âá∫Áé∞ËøôÁßçÊÉÖÂÜµÊòØÂõ†‰∏∫‰ªñ‰ª¨Ê≤°ÊúâÊÑèËØÜÂà∞‰ªñ‰ª¨‰ΩìÂÜÖÊΩúÂú®ÁöÑÁ≤æÂäõÂíåÁù°Áú†Êú∫Âà∂ÔºàEnergy and sleep mechanismÔºâ

ËøôÂè•ËØùÁÇπÂá∫‰∫ÜÂæà‰πÖÂæà‰πÖ‰ª•ÂâçÔºåÂ∞èÊ≥ïÂ∏àÊúâÊó∂Áù° 10 ‰∏™Â∞èÊó∂ÔºåÈÜíÊù•ËøòÊòØÊÑüÂà∞Áñ≤Âä≥Âõ∞ÂÄ¶Á≤æÂäõ‰∏çË∂≥ÁöÑÂéüÂõ†

‰πãÂêéÂ∞èÊ≥ïÂ∏àÊ†πÊçÆËá™Â∑± Deep sleep Âíå REM ÁöÑÂë®ÊúüÔºåÂÅö‰∫ÜÈÄÇÂΩìË∞ÉÊï¥ÔºåÂπ∂Âä†Âº∫ÂÖâÁÖßÔºàÊ≥®ÊÑèÊòØË§™ÈªëÁ¥†ÔºåËÄå‰∏çÊòØÂÖâÂêà‰ΩúÁî®Ôºâ

Âç≥‰ΩøÂú®Âº∫Â§ßÁöÑÂ∑•‰ΩúÈ∏≠Ê¢®‰∏ãÔºåÁù°Áú†Ë¥®ÈáèËøòÊòØÂëàÁ∫øÊÄßÊèêÈ´ò

ÂêéÊù•Â∞èÊ≥ïÂ∏àÂèà‰∫ÜËß£Âà∞‰∫ÜÁ•ûÂ•áÁöÑ ËææËä¨Â•áÁù°Áú†ÔºåÂèàÁß∞ Â§öÈ°πÁù°Áú†ÔºàPolyphasic sleepÔºâ

Â¶ÇÊûú‰ªñÁúãËøá ÁßÅÂØÜÁöÑÁ•ûËØùÔºåÂ∫îËØ•Â∞±‰∏ç‰ºöÂÅöËøôÁßçÊÑöË†¢ÁöÑ‰∫ãÊÉÖ‰∫Ü

‰∫ãÂÆû‰∏äÔºåNREM REM ÈÉΩÊòØÊúâÂÖ∂‰∏çÂèØÊõø‰ª£ÁöÑ‰ΩúÁî®ÁöÑ
È¶ñÂÖàÔºåREM Âπ∂‰∏çÊòØ‰∫∫Á±ªÁöÑ‰∏ìÂà©ÔºåÂì∫‰π≥Á±ªÂíåÈ∏üÁ±ªÈÉΩ‰ºöÂèëÁîüÔºõÂÖ∂Ê¨°ÔºåÂú® NREM Èò∂ÊÆµÂÖ∂Ë°®ËææÊñπÂºèÂèØËÉΩÊòØ ‚ÄúÊÑüËßâ‚ÄùÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•ËøôÊó∂ËôΩÊ≤°ÊúâÊ¢¶ÁöÑ‰∫ßÁîüÔºå‰ΩÜ‰∏ç‰ª£Ë°®ÂèØ‰ª•ÈöèÊÑèÁº©Áü≠

entry.title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
entry.content:
When I read Chinese version of HP4, I was still in junior middle school.

In the final battle, One of my classmate was amused by Avada Kedavra VS. Expelliarmus, and I had the same feeling.

Because Harry should beat Voldemort and fight endless Death Eaters all by himself, and married Hermione Qiu Ginny‚Ä¶ if it‚Äôs a Chinese novel.

And now, I no longer a child and begin to realize how brave Harry is.

entry.title: Learn more study less
entry.content:
When I was in high shool, there was a student in my class. For the first time in my life I saw an intellect.

I never saw he was studing. Playing games or reading novels were all the things I can see.

There are also some studiaholics, which means they can approach the intellects on score through hard work.

Sadly turth is I was none of them.

I studied harder and harder, but the score was still no improve.

You can image how desperate I was, which means they are gifted and talented, and I was nothing. I‚Äôm a losser even when I was born.

After so many years have passed, I was undertood that it was just the brain‚Äôs magic.

This book, written by an intellect, describe ‚ÄúHow the Steel was Tempered‚Äù.

There Is Always Hope, Thank God.

MINDMAP:

entry.title: Hard Convercations with parents
entry.content:
I‚Äôm not chilled. I‚Äôm speechless.

Graduating and choosing a job so I can study.
I just got a job and every call makes me take a civil service exam (what about those who say they need to call from time to time and be in touch often, what about this situation?)
Gap Year (didn‚Äôt ask my parents for a penny) and still dislikes me every day.

Anyway, it just feels like you‚Äôre their property, and LZ brought you into the world, so you don‚Äôt do what I say?
Fuck! You‚Äôve grown up and you‚Äôre not going to listen to me, are you? You can‚Äôt stand it!

Then begins, to dictate to you, in a vain attempt to tamper with your life:

  1. Use of force and brainwashing (it‚Äôs been going on since I was a kid, now I just have to flip the switch)
    Move out of the mojo, ‚ÄúIf the ruler wants the minister to die, the minister has to die. If the father wants the son to die, the son has to die.‚Äù
    Take out of context ‚ÄúIf parents are present, they will not travel far‚Äù (travel must be done)
    of all virtues filial piety is the most important
    ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

PS: Did they watch 1984? I‚Äôm so shallow.

But you‚Äôve probably been showered with Western ideas of equality, read about it.
Rousseau‚Äôs ‚ÄúOn the Origin of Human Inequality,‚Äù Russell‚Äôs ‚ÄúHistory of Western Philosophy,‚Äù Thoreau‚Äôs ‚ÄúWalden Lake‚Äù and a series of other masterpieces
He‚Äôs moving towards independence of thought. He doesn‚Äôt give a shit about Confucius and Mencius.

Never mind.

  1. Kidnapping you with material things.
    Common: full payment, down payment, job placement, etc.

According to Influence, give the other person the benefit of the doubt and they don‚Äôt feel indebted to you so they can get more out of it
In other words, ‚ÄúI‚Äôll take your word for it, but I‚Äôll take your hand for it.‚Äù

But you may have read Krishnamurti‚Äôs ‚ÄúWhat You Mustn‚Äôt Expect in Life‚Äù, Lao Tzu‚Äôs ‚ÄúTao Te Ching‚Äù, ‚ÄúThe Power of the Present Moment‚Äù in your weak years.
Knowing that life should liberate itself and seek inner peace.
LZ can stand on his own two feet, but he‚Äôs still alive and well.

I‚Äôm financially independent now, so I can‚Äôt do anything to you.

That‚Äôs okay. Here‚Äôs more.

  1. the trick of inflicting injury on oneself
    Even if you‚Äôre a bull shit.
    No one can be heartless. After all, blood is thicker than water.
    They tried to kidnap you with their affection.
    ‚ÄúThis life is for you‚Äù and ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt blame your parents, they‚Äôve given you the best.‚Äù

I‚Äôll be damned. Do you think ‚Äúbest‚Äù is what I want?

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre doing this for you, are you doing me justice?‚Äù
O__O‚Äù‚Ä¶
Where did you get this sourpuss? (This deeply sacrificial parent was mentioned in The Road Less Traveled, awkward)

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre your parents, of course we care about you.‚Äù
Come on, it‚Äôs a control freak thing. It‚Äôs not a concern.
Caring for someone in that tone?

PS: Lovers have this problem with each other too

That‚Äôs a bit harsh, isn‚Äôt it?
In fact, most of the parents‚Äô generation (they were once young too, okay?) became victims of a general lack of education
Black-and-white thinking, people following the crowd, no ability to think for themselves

It causes them to be unaware of the inappropriateness of their thoughts, ideas, attitudes, and tone of voice
It‚Äôs useless to ignore the objective facts, and to insist that you are right. After all, you eat more salt than a child eats rice, and it‚Äôs like ‚Äúwhat I say is the truth of the universe‚Äù.

As a kid, it‚Äôs pretty sad to see them use that tone of voice, knowing it‚Äôs not them
The best way (that I can think of right now) is probably just to pander and do some ‚Äúnice lies‚Äù to cheer them up.
But when it comes to something big, the paper can‚Äôt hold the fire, and conflict is inevitable.

Due to age, it is almost impossible for the elderly to be exposed to new ideas, and it is no longer realistic to ask the older generation to change
But we can move on to the next generation - I don‚Äôt know if you realize that our generation is going to be parents too.

So we can ask questions like, ‚ÄúHow to communicate with my parents‚Äù, ‚ÄúHow to keep my parents from getting angry‚Äù, ‚ÄúWhat is the best way to make myself think that my parents‚Äô advice is right‚Äù, ‚ÄúHow to be an obedient child‚Äù, ‚ÄúHow to convince them that I want to go for civil service/graduate/doctoral/ post-graduate exams or stay in my hometown if my parents don‚Äôt want me to.‚Äù

And then you give them a sidelong reminder that they‚Äôre in the know.

entry.title: Use Github Pages as a blog
entry.content:
Finally, I found here since I wanted a blog of my own several months ago.

There are a lot of Public blogs such as douban, sina, but none of them I liked.

I just want a place where no one knows me, and I can record some of my weird experience or ideas.

Qzone was my long used blog, but all people in there were my friends or colleagues. I do not want to treated as a Psychopathy. ^_^

I followed jekyllrb, step by step, it seems worked, the page was online!

(Now, I‚Äôm using Hexo instead of jekyll)

In fact, I heard github can be used as a Blog from one of my schoolmates one year ago. But this task was put off day by day. I thought that there must be a lot configs to setup. Not only I do not like complications, but also as a procrastinator.

English Is Killing Me, I haven‚Äôt had enough capability to do this.

entry.title: Bye, my college
entry.content:
ÂÜçËßÅ‰∫ÜÔºåÊàëÁöÑÂ§ßÂ≠¶

ÊàëËÆ∞Âæó‰∏äÊ¨°ÂàöÂà∞Êù≠Â∑ûÔºåÁúãÂà∞Ëøô‰∏™ËçâÊú®ÊàêÁæ§ÁöÑÁæé‰∏ΩÂüéÂ∏ÇÔºåË≤å‰ººÊäíÂèëËøá‰∏ÄÊ¨°‚Ä¶
ËøôÁßçËÄóË¥π‰∫ÜÂõõÂπ¥ÂÖâÈò¥„ÄÅÁîüÂëΩ‰∏≠Á¨¨‰∏ÄÊ¨°ÊÑüÂà∞Ëá™Áî±ÁöÑÂú∞ÊñπÔºåÂè™ÂÜçËßÅ‰∏ÄÊ¨°ÊûúÁÑ∂ÊòØ‰∏çÂ§üÁöÑ‚Ä¶
ÂΩìÁÑ∂Êàë‰πüÊ≤°Âï•ÁâõÈÄºÁöÑÁªèÂéÜÂÄºÂæóÂÜôÂá∫Êù•ÔºåÂπ≥Âπ≥Ê∑°Ê∑°ÁöÑËøáÊéâ‰∫ÜÔºåÁ∫ØÁ≤πÊäíÂèë‰∏ãÊÑüÊÉÖÂêß

‰ªéÂâç‰∏§Â§©ÂÖ≠Á∫ß‰∏ãÊù•ÔºåÂà∞‰ªäÂ§©ÊêûÂÆöËøô‰ª∂Êãñ‰∫Ü 3.5 Âπ¥ÔºåÁ∫†ÁªìËá≥‰ªäÁöÑ‰∫ãÊÉÖ
ÊàëÊÉ≥ÔºåÂ§ßÂ≠¶Êó∂‰ª£ÔºåÂú®ÊàëÁöÑÁîüÂëΩÈáåÔºåÁúüÁöÑËøáÂéª‰∫Ü

ËÆ∞ÂæóÊúâÂ§©Â§úÈáåÔºåÊ¢¶Âà∞ N Â§öÁöÑËöäÂ≠êÔºåÊääÊàëÁóíÁöÑ‰∏çË°åÔºåÂøÉÊÉ≥ÔºåËøôÁ•ûÈ©¨Á†¥Ê¢¶ÂïäÔºåÊØîÁôΩÈ™®Êõ¥ÈöæÂèóÂïä
ÁÑ∂ÂêéÊàëÂ∞±Á´ôÂú®ÂùüÂú∞‰∫Ü‚Ä¶‚Ä¶
ËôΩÁÑ∂ÂëäËØ´Ëá™Â∑±‰∏çË¶ÅÂÆ≥ÊÄïÔºåÊ¢¶ÂòõÔºåjust feel itÔºåtaste it.
Â•ΩÂêßÔºåÊàëÊÄÇ‰∫ÜÔºåÁÑ∂ÂêéÊÉ≥Ë∑ëÔºåÂæÄÂì™Ë∑ëÂë¢Ôºü
ÂóØÂóØÔºåÁà∂ÊØçÂ∞±Âú®ÈöîÂ£ÅÔºåË∑ëÂà∞‰ªñ‰ª¨ÈÇ£ÈáåÂ•Ω‰∫Ü
Áà∂ÊØçÔºåÂÆ∂Ôºå‰∏ÄÁõ¥ÊòØÊàë‰ª¨Âèó‰º§ÂêéÔºåÈÅøÈ£éÁöÑÊ∏ØÊπæ„ÄÇ

ÂèØÊÉúÂïäÔºåÁÑ∂ÂêéÊàëÈÜí‰∫ÜÔºåÂèëÁé∞Ëá™Â∑±Â≠§Â≠§ÂçïÂçï‰∏Ä‰∏™‰∫∫ÔºåÂú®ÁßüÁöÑÊàøÂ≠êÈáåÔºåÈöîÂ£ÅÁöÑÊòØ‰ªéÊ≤°ËßÅËøáÁ¥†‰∏çÁõ∏ËØÜÁöÑÈôåÁîü‰∫∫
ÁúüÁöÑÁ¶ªÂºÄ‰∫ÜÔºåÈïøÂ§ß‰∫Ü
ËÆ∞ÂæóÊúâÂè•ËØùÔºö

Áã¨Á´ãÊÑèÂë≥ÁùÄÊõ¥Â§ßÁöÑÁ§æ‰ºöË¥£‰ªªÔºåËá™Áî±ÊÑèÂë≥ÁùÄÊõ¥Â§öÁöÑÂåÖÂÆπÔºåËß£ÊîæÊÑèÂë≥ÁùÄÊõ¥Â§öÁöÑËá™ÊàëÁÆ°ÁêÜÔºåÈïøÂ§ßÊÑèÂë≥ÁùÄÊõ¥Â§öÁöÑ‰ªòÂá∫„ÄÇ
‰∏çÁ¶ÅÊÉ≥Ëµ∑ peter ÁöÑ‰ºØÁà∂ÈÇ£Âè•‚ÄúThe great ability comes great responsibility.‚Äù

ËôΩÁÑ∂Êàë‰∏ÄÁõ¥ÂêëÂæÄÁùÄÁã¨Á´ãËá™Áî±Ôºå‰ΩÜÁúüÊ≠£Âà∞‰∫ÜËøôÈáåÔºåÂú®Êüê‰∏™Áû¨Èó¥ÔºåËøòÊòØÊúâÁßçÂ¶ÇËÄÅÂ§ßÊèèËø∞ÁöÑ‚ÄúÊ∑°Ê∑°ÁöÑÂìÄ‰º§‚Äù

ËΩ¨ÂÖ•Ê≠£È¢òÂêß
ÊàëÁöÑÈÇ£‰∏™Â§ßÂ≠¶ÂêßÔºåÊØîËæÉÂ•ΩÁé©
Âú®ÊàëÂÖ•Ê†°Êó∂ÔºåÊòØÊàëÈ´ò‰∏≠Êó∂ÂêëÊù•ÈÑôËßÜÁöÑ‰∫åÊú¨Â≠¶Ê†°
ËÆ§ËÆ§ÁúüÁúüÁöÑ‰∏äÂÆåÂ§ß‰∏ÄÂçäÂπ¥ÔºåÊ≤°Âï•ÂèòÂåñ
Â§ß‰∫åÂºÄÂßãÈÄÉËØæ‰∫ÜÔºå‰∏ì‰∏öÂçá‰∏ÄÊú¨‰∫Ü
Â§ß‰∏âÂÜç‰πü‰∏çÂéª‰∏äËØæÊó∂ÔºåÊï¥‰∏™Â≠¶Ê†°ÈÉΩÊòØ‰∏ÄÊú¨‰∫Ü

ÂÖ≠Á∫ß

ÂÆûÈôÖ‰∏äÂ∑≤ÁªèÊ≤°ÊúâÈÄöËøá‰∏çÈÄöËøáËøô‰∏ÄÂõû‰∫ã
Âπ∂‰∏îÔºåÊØï‰∏öÂêéÔºå‰∏™‰∫∫ÊÑüËßâÔºåËØÅ‰π¶ÈÉΩÊòØÊµÆ‰∫ë‰∫Ü
‰∏çËøáÔºåÁÆóÊòØÁªôÁà∂ÊØç‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂÆâÊÖ∞Âêß„ÄÇÔºàÊú¨Êù•Êàë‰ª•‰∏∫‰∏äÊ¨°ËÄÅÁà∏Êù•ÔºåÊòØ‰ªñÊúÄÂêé‰∏ÄÊ¨°ÁªôÂÅ∂Ôø•ÔºåËøôÊ¨°ÁúãÊù•ÔºåÂèàÂèØ‰ª•Êï≤ËØà‰ªñ‰ª¨‰∏ÄÁ¨î‰∫Ü O(‚à©_‚à©)OÔºâ
ËÄå‰∏îÔºå‰πüÁÆóÊòØÂØπËá™Â∑±ÁöÑÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÁöÑÁîüÊ∂ØÁîª‰∏ä‰∏Ä‰∏™Âè•Âè∑Âêß„ÄÇ

ÂΩìÁÑ∂‚Ä¶‚Ä¶
Ë¶ÅÊòØ‰ªñ‰ª¨Áü•ÈÅì‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

Fake-Everything
Fake Everything
=======

If you don‚Äôt know what is Everything, just look at here

Everything is a proprietary freeware Windows desktop search engine that can rapidly find files and folders by name on an NTFS volume.

All methods reading and hashing the NTFS Volume are in /QSearch/Volume.h

Usage

  1. Save image above as -> *.jpg
  2. rename .jpg -> .7z
  3. unzip *.7z -> (QSearch.exe config.ini)

Rapid positioning of the NTFS disk files

Lei Hao

(School of Information & Computer, Anhui Agricultural University, Hefei 230036)

AbstractÔºöThis article describes on windows NTFS disk, the
enumeration all the names of the files and folders on the hard disk ,
and to build a hash table by using C++ STL, MFC GUI and worker thread.
Ultimately the user to enter keywords , as a simple search like google
keyword search , and then instantly return all matching files / folders
and their system path.

Key words : NTFS, Fast, Search, Keywords, File Path
